CVE-2024-12088
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T22:15:26.600000

4 posts

A flaw was found in rsync. When using the `--safe-links` option, rsync fails to properly verify if a symbolic link destination contains another symbolic link within it. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, which may lead to arbitrary file write outside the desired directory.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T18:46:24.703Z ##

@grey @screaminggoat Still laughing at CVE-2024-12088:

A flaw was found in rsync. When using the --safe-links option, rsync fails to properly verify if a symbolic link destination contains another symbolic link within it. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, which may lead to arbitrary file write outside the desired directory.

Talk about false advertising.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T18:46:24.000Z ##

@grey @screaminggoat Still laughing at CVE-2024-12088:

A flaw was found in rsync. When using the --safe-links option, rsync fails to properly verify if a symbolic link destination contains another symbolic link within it. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, which may lead to arbitrary file write outside the desired directory.

Talk about false advertising.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.000Z ##

Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write

##

CVE-2024-12086
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T22:15:26.370000

2 posts

A flaw was found in rsync. It could allow a server to enumerate the contents of an arbitrary file from the client's machine. This issue occurs when files are being copied from a client to a server. During this process, the rsync server will send checksums of local data to the client to compare with in order to determine what data needs to be sent to the server. By sending specially constructed che

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

CVE-2024-48857
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T21:31:54

2 posts

NULL pointer dereference in the PCX image codec in QNX SDP versions 8.0, 7.1 and 7.0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition in the context of the process using the image codec.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T19:28:55.370Z ##

I did not wake up this morning expecting to see a critical RCE in Blackberry QNX, but here we are anyway.

https://support.blackberry.com/pkb/s/article/140334

Out-of-bounds write in the PCX image codec in QNX SDP versions 8.0, 7.1 and 7.0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition or execute code in the context of the process using the image codec.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48856

There are a few others in the advisory too:

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48854

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48855

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48857

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48858

CVE-2025-21333
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T18:32:16

18 posts

Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-14T20:20:02.000Z ##

Microsoft Patches Trio of Exploited Windows Hyper-V Zero-Days https://www.securityweek.com/microsoft-patches-trio-of-exploited-windows-hyper-v-zero-days/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE202521333 #CVE202521334 #CVE202521335 #PatchTuesday #Microsoft #HyperV

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-14T20:20:02.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.997Z ##

CISA:

  • CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
  • CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

Product: Windows
Date Added: 2025-01-14

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: EIGHT ZERO-DAYS (3 exploited, 5 publicly disclosed, 159 new CVEs)

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2025-21308 (6.5 medium) Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21275 (7.8 high) Windows App Package Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21186 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21395 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2025-21366 (7.8 high) Microsoft Access Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.997Z ##

CISA:

  • CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
  • CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-12085
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T18:32:05

2 posts

A flaw was found in the rsync daemon which could be triggered when rsync compares file checksums. This flaw allows an attacker to manipulate the checksum length (s2length) to cause a comparison between a checksum and uninitialized memory and leak one byte of uninitialized stack data at a time.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.000Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-12747
(5.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T18:32:01

2 posts

A flaw was found in rsync. This vulnerability arises from a race condition during rsync's handling of symbolic links. Rsync's default behavior when encountering symbolic links is to skip them. If an attacker replaced a regular file with a symbolic link at the right time, it was possible to bypass the default behavior and traverse symbolic links. Depending on the privileges of the rsync process, an

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

##

CVE-2024-12087
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T18:32:00

2 posts

A path traversal vulnerability exists in rsync. It stems from behavior enabled by the `--inc-recursive` option, a default-enabled option for many client options and can be enabled by the server even if not explicitly enabled by the client. When using the `--inc-recursive` option, a lack of proper symlink verification coupled with deduplication checks occurring on a per-file-list basis could allow

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write

CVE-2025-21298
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T18:15:52.080000

4 posts

Windows OLE Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

_r_netsec at 2025-01-14T19:43:06.526Z ##

New Microsoft OLE Vulnerability, Exploitable via Email https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21298

##
mttaggart at 2025-01-14T19:33:08.606Z ##

Well dang CVE-2025-21298

This bug rates a CVSS 9.8 and allows a remote attacker to execute code on a target system by sending a specially crafted mail to an affected system with Outlook. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of RTF files.

https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2025/1/14/the-january-2025-security-update-review

##
_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T19:43:06.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-10630
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T17:15:13.857000

2 posts

A race condition in Ivanti Application Control Engine before version 10.14.4.0 allows a local authenticated attacker to bypass the application blocking functionality.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.574Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

##

CVE-2024-11734
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T16:38:59

1 posts

A potential Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability has been identified in Keycloak, which could allow an administrative user with the rights to change realm settings to disrupt the service. This is done by modifying any of the security headers and inserting newlines, which causes the Keycloak server to write to a request that is already terminated, leading to a failure of said request. Service dis

frehi@fosstodon.org at 2025-01-13T16:18:55.000Z ##

New #keycloak release 26.0.8 available.

Appears to fix a security problem according to the commit log: CVE-2024-11734

https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/releases

#keycloak

##

CVE-2025-0282
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.95%

updated 2025-01-14T15:59:38.157000

114 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

6 repos

https://github.com/securexploit1/CVE-2025-0282

https://github.com/rxwx/pulse-meter

https://github.com/absholi7ly/CVE-2025-0282-Ivanti-exploit

https://github.com/AnonStorks/CVE-2025-0282-Full-version

https://github.com/NyxanGoat/CVE-2025-0282-PoC

https://github.com/BishopFox/CVE-2025-0282-check

threatcodex at 2025-01-13T18:20:14.684Z ##

Exploitation Walkthrough and Techniques - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
#CVE_2025_0282
https://labs.watchtowr.com/exploitation-walkthrough-and-techniques-ivanti-connect-secure-rce-cve-2025-0282/

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-12T14:12:33.553Z ##

watchTowr: Exploitation Walkthrough and Techniques - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
See parent toots for details. Following up on the root cause analysis of CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability, watchTowr provides a walkthrough of how they approached exploiting the vulnerability. They intend to publicly release a "Detection Artifact Generator" (read: proof of concept) until 16 January 2025 (another 4 days) cc: @wdormann

#ivanti #CVE_2025_0282 #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cisakev #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-10T02:21:08.770Z ##

watchTowr: Do Secure-By-Design Pledges Come With Stickers? - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
Absolutely scathing review and rightful criticism of Ivanti as watchTowr successfully reproduces CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. I'm here for the McMemes and I'm lovin' it.® watchTowr does not provide the proof of concept but it's not necessary as it's already being exploited in the wild by threat actors.

cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann

#ivanti #zeroday #cve_2025_0282 #eitw #vulnerability #cve #activeexploitation #cisa #cisakev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
threatcodex at 2025-01-09T14:52:18.566Z ##

Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283 #UNC5337 #UNC5221 #PHASEJAM #SPAWNMOLE
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/

##
threatcodex at 2025-01-09T14:42:30.689Z ##

Active exploitation of vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283
https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/active-exploitation-ivanti-vulnerability

##
decio at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.991Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #IoC #postexploitation
#attribution
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-09T05:45:59.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-0282 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-0282/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_0282

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-08T23:50:01.604Z ##

CISA: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
This is absolutely fancy: CISA provides guidance on mitigating CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. This includes steps to take if your threat hunting determines that there was a compromise. Shoutout to CISA to enriching the standard KEV addition blog post.

#cisa #CVE_2025_0282 #ivanti #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-08T17:54:02.897Z ##

NCSC-UK: Active exploitation of vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways products
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC-UK) has one of the earliest government security advisories about CVE-2025-0282 exploitation. See parent toots above for details.

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-08T17:49:20.082Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
So hot off the press that it's not live yet 🥵🔥🔥
CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

Today's Ivanti exploited zero-day has been added to the CISA KEV Catalog cc: @ntkramer

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-09T05:45:59.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T23:50:01.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
This is absolutely fancy: CISA provides guidance on mitigating CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. This includes steps to take if your threat hunting determines that there was a compromise. Shoutout to CISA to enriching the standard KEV addition blog post.

#cisa #CVE_2025_0282 #ivanti #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T17:54:02.000Z ##

NCSC-UK: Active exploitation of vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways products
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC-UK) has one of the earliest government security advisories about CVE-2025-0282 exploitation. See parent toots above for details.

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T17:49:20.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
So hot off the press that it's not live yet 🥵🔥🔥
CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

Today's Ivanti exploited zero-day has been added to the CISA KEV Catalog cc: @ntkramer

#cisa #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #ivanti #CVE_2025_0282

threatcodex at 2025-01-13T18:20:14.684Z ##

Exploitation Walkthrough and Techniques - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-12T14:12:33.553Z ##

watchTowr: Exploitation Walkthrough and Techniques - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
See parent toots for details. Following up on the root cause analysis of CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability, watchTowr provides a walkthrough of how they approached exploiting the vulnerability. They intend to publicly release a "Detection Artifact Generator" (read: proof of concept) until 16 January 2025 (another 4 days) cc: @wdormann

#ivanti #CVE_2025_0282 #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cisakev #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-10T02:21:08.770Z ##

watchTowr: Do Secure-By-Design Pledges Come With Stickers? - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282)
Absolutely scathing review and rightful criticism of Ivanti as watchTowr successfully reproduces CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. I'm here for the McMemes and I'm lovin' it.® watchTowr does not provide the proof of concept but it's not necessary as it's already being exploited in the wild by threat actors.

cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann

##
decio at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.991Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #IoC #postexploitation
#attribution
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283

decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.000Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

##
cert_fr@social.numerique.gouv.fr at 2025-01-14T17:04:36.000Z ##

⚠️Alerte CERT-FR⚠️

CERTFR-2025-ALE-001 : La vulnérabilité CVE-2025-0282 affecte les équipements Ivanti et permet à un attaquant non authentifié de provoquer une exécution de code arbitraire à distance.
Elle est activement exploitée.
https://www.cert.ssi.gouv.fr/alerte/CERTFR-2025-ALE-001/

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.574Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

AAKL at 2025-01-10T15:58:50.269Z ##

WatchTower: Do Secure-By-Design Pledges Come With Stickers? - Ivanti Connect Secure RCE (CVE-2025-0282) https://labs.watchtowr.com/do-secure-by-design-pledges-come-with-stickers-ivanti-connect-secure-rce-cve-2025-0282/ #cybersecurity #infosec

##
mersan at 2025-01-10T12:15:25.884Z ##

📶 Ivanti 0Day CVSS 9.0 🆘

✍️ Las VPN corporativas se convierten en puertas traseras para los piratas informáticos chinos.

➡️ Se ha descubierto una vulnerabilidad crítica con una clasificación CVSS de 9.0 en los productos de Ivanti (https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day) que permite la ejecución remota de código sin autorización.

🔥 El grupo chino UNC5337 ya está explotando activamente la brecha para penetrar en las redes corporativas.

👨‍💻 Los piratas informáticos utilizan el ecosistema malicioso SPAWN para robar sesiones y contraseñas de VPN. Al mismo tiempo, los atacantes utilizan herramientas especiales para ocultar rastros de su presencia en el sistema.

⚡️ CISA requiere que las agencias federales instalen actualizaciones de seguridad antes del 15 de enero. Se recomienda a todas las organizaciones que escaneen urgentemente sus sistemas para detectar señales de compromiso.

CVE-2025-0283 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0283)
CVE-2025-0282 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0282)
Cisa Vulnerability Kev Catalog (https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/08/cisa-adds-one-vulnerability-kev-catalog)

S.I Stega Intelligence

🪪 Nuestros Contactos (https://stegaops.com/contact/)

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T01:50:22.928Z ##

@jerry Ivanti zero-day mega-toot:

  • Ivanti blog post: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways
  • Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283)
  • U.S. CISA mitigation guidance: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
  • Mandiant observed post-exploitation activity and forensics (includes IOC, Yara): Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation

Government security advisories:

  • U.S.: Ivanti Releases Security Updates for Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways; CISA Adds One Vulnerability to the KEV Catalog
  • Canada: Ivanti security advisory (AV25-008)
  • UK: Active exploitation of vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure

Regular infosec news reporting:

  • Security Week: Ivanti Warns of New Zero-Day Attacks Hitting Connect Secure Product
  • The Record: Ivanti warns hackers are exploiting new vulnerability
  • Bleeping Computer: Ivanti warns of new Connect Secure flaw used in zero-day attacks
##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T01:07:27.105Z ##

Mandiant: Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above. Mandiant has identified zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 in the wild beginning mid-December 2024. CVE-2025-0282 is an unauthenticated stack-based buffer overflow. Successful exploitation could result in unauthenticated remote code execution, leading to potential downstream compromise of a victim network.

Mandiant describes the exploitation details, and observed post-exploitation activity by the threat actor. This includes anti-forensics measures, persistence, malware deployment, and credential harvesting. Mandiant does not make a strong attribution but notes that UNC5337, a China-nexus cluster, is the only threat actor known to deploy the SPAWN ecosystem of malware on Ivanti Connect Secure appliances. Mandiant suspects with medium confidence that UNC5337 is part of UNC5221. Yara rules are free but indicators of compromise are behind a registration wall on VirusTotal.

#china #cyberespionage #ivanti #zeroday #CVE_2024_0282 #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Yara #infosec #cybersecurity #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T01:07:27.000Z ##

Mandiant: Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above. Mandiant has identified zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 in the wild beginning mid-December 2024. CVE-2025-0282 is an unauthenticated stack-based buffer overflow. Successful exploitation could result in unauthenticated remote code execution, leading to potential downstream compromise of a victim network.

Mandiant describes the exploitation details, and observed post-exploitation activity by the threat actor. This includes anti-forensics measures, persistence, malware deployment, and credential harvesting. Mandiant does not make a strong attribution but notes that UNC5337, a China-nexus cluster, is the only threat actor known to deploy the SPAWN ecosystem of malware on Ivanti Connect Secure appliances. Mandiant suspects with medium confidence that UNC5337 is part of UNC5221. Yara rules are free but indicators of compromise are behind a registration wall on VirusTotal.

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-01-08T23:00:46.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2025-0282
Vendor: Ivanti
Product: Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways
Date Added: 2025-01-08
Vulnerability: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways Stack-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Notes: https://www.cisa.gov/cisa-mitigation-instructions-CVE-2025-0282 ; https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-Policy-Secure-ZTA-Gateways-CVE-2025-0282-CVE-2025-0283 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0282

The vulnerabilities, identified as CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283, are currently being actively exploited by malicious actors.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-08T18:49:02.000Z ##

Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways customers, it's time to upgrade again as there's another two zero days already being exploited in the wild - CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283

Unauth code execution.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-Policy-Secure-ZTA-Gateways-CVE-2025-0282-CVE-2025-0283?language=en_US

ASLR prevents buffer overflow attacks, which CVE-2025-0282 is. However only about 5% of binaries in Ivanti's 'secure' Linux appliance have ASLR enabled - a two decade old security control. #yolosec https://infosec.exchange/@wdormann/113794200056523116

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T18:20:13.000Z ##

New #Ivanti Connect Secure #0day — I'm sure we'll see Mandiant and MSTIC write-ups shortly on whichever threat campaign/actor was hitting CVE-2025-0282. https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2025/01/08/etr-cve-2025-0282-ivanti-connect-secure-zero-day-exploited-in-the-wild/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T18:11:17.000Z ##

@wdormann I created a vendor verbiage page to decipher the sometimes obfuscated wording of exploitation: https://infosec.press/screaminggoat/vendor-verbiage In this case, it was straightforward:

We are aware of a limited number of customers’ Ivanti Connect Secure appliances which have been exploited by CVE-2025-0282 at the time of disclosure.

CISA appears to be adding it to the KEV Catalog: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/08/cisa-adds-one-vulnerability-kev-catalog (Access Denied usually means the URL is correct but* the page isn't published yet) EDIT: Page is live.

and NCSC had the first government advisory about it: https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/active-exploitation-ivanti-vulnerabilities

I blasted it on Mastodon an hour ago: https://infosec.exchange/@screaminggoat/113793817841894943

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T17:04:23.000Z ##

IVANTI ZERO-DAY: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways

  • CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) stack-based buffer overflow > unauth RCE
  • CVE-2025-0283 (7.0 high) authenticated LPE

We are aware of a limited number of customers’ Ivanti Connect Secure appliances which have been exploited by CVE-2025-0282 at the time of disclosure.

Check out the Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283) for frequently asked questions. cc: @goatyell

#zeroday #ivanti #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation

##

CVE-2025-0283
(7.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:58:55.813000

36 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure before version 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways before version 22.7R2.3 allows a local authenticated attacker to escalate their privileges.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-13T08:40:03.000Z ##

Ivanti Rolls Out Patches to Mitigate Exploits in Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways https://thecyberexpress.com/ivanti-vulnerabilities-patches-roll-out/ #Ivantivulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #IvantiPolicySecure #VulnerabilityNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20250282 #CVE20250283 #CyberNews

##
decio at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.991Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #IoC #postexploitation
#attribution
#CVE_2025_0282 #CVE_2025_0283

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T07:34:30.000Z ##

⚠️ Nouvelle vulnérabilité Zero-Day ciblant les VPN Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2025-0282)

#Mandiant a publié les premiers signes d'exploitation (avec une première attribution à UNC5337) :

🔍 Étapes courantes identifiées lors de l'exploitation :
1️⃣ Désactive SELinux
2️⃣ Bloque le transfert des journaux syslog
3️⃣ Re-monte le disque en lecture-écriture
4️⃣ Écrit un script malveillant
5️⃣ Exécuter ce script
6️⃣ Déploie un ou plusieurs web shells
7️⃣ Modifie les journaux pour cacher l'activité
8️⃣ Réactive SELinux
9️⃣ Re-monte le disque

🛑 Techniques de dissimulation post-exploitation :

  • Suppression des messages kernel avec dmesg et modification des journaux de débogage.
  • Effacement des dumps de l'état et des core dumps des crashs.
  • Suppression des entrées liées aux échecs syslog, erreurs ICT internes, traces de crash et erreurs de certificat.
  • Modification du journal d’audit SELinux pour masquer les commandes exécutées.

💡 Observations supplémentaires :

CVE-2025-0282 affecte plusieurs niveaux de patch d’ICS release 22.7R2.

Exploitation réussie dépendante de la version spécifique.

Des requêtes répétées au VPN sont observées avant exploitation, probablement pour identifier la version.

🗂️ Fichiers ciblés :
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.2615.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3191.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3221.jar
/dana-cached/hc/hc_launcher.22.7.2.3431.jar

⚠️Mandiant informe avoir observé des signes d'exploitation active en nature depuis mi-décembre 2024.

"Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation"
👇
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day/?hl=en

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:24:42.574Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: January Security Update
Bottom line up front: "We have no evidence of any of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild."
Links:

  • Security Advisory Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.7 (Multiple CVEs)
  • Security Advisory - Ivanti Application Control Engine (CVE-2024-10630)
    • (AC Engine is present on Ivanti Application Control, Ivanti Neurons for App Control and can integrate with Ivanti Security Controls and Ivanti Endpoint Manager)
  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

These are unrelated to the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 inside of Ivanti Connect Security, Policy Secure and ZTA Gateways advisory from 08 January 2025.

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

Hackread@mstdn.social at 2025-01-10T21:30:42.000Z ##

🚨 Urgent Security Alert: Ivanti reveals critical vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-0282 & CVE-2025-0283) in Connect Secure, Policy Secure, & ZTA Gateways. Patch Connect Secure now (v22.7R2.5) & isolate affected systems.

Read: https://hackread.com/ivanti-patch-flaws-connect-secure-policy-secure-zta-gateways/

##
mersan at 2025-01-10T12:15:25.884Z ##

📶 Ivanti 0Day CVSS 9.0 🆘

✍️ Las VPN corporativas se convierten en puertas traseras para los piratas informáticos chinos.

➡️ Se ha descubierto una vulnerabilidad crítica con una clasificación CVSS de 9.0 en los productos de Ivanti (https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day) que permite la ejecución remota de código sin autorización.

🔥 El grupo chino UNC5337 ya está explotando activamente la brecha para penetrar en las redes corporativas.

👨‍💻 Los piratas informáticos utilizan el ecosistema malicioso SPAWN para robar sesiones y contraseñas de VPN. Al mismo tiempo, los atacantes utilizan herramientas especiales para ocultar rastros de su presencia en el sistema.

⚡️ CISA requiere que las agencias federales instalen actualizaciones de seguridad antes del 15 de enero. Se recomienda a todas las organizaciones que escaneen urgentemente sus sistemas para detectar señales de compromiso.

CVE-2025-0283 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0283)
CVE-2025-0282 (https://feedly.com/cve/CVE-2025-0282)
Cisa Vulnerability Kev Catalog (https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/08/cisa-adds-one-vulnerability-kev-catalog)

S.I Stega Intelligence

🪪 Nuestros Contactos (https://stegaops.com/contact/)

##
VirusBulletin at 2025-01-09T10:34:32.597Z ##

Researchers from Mandiant and Ivanti look into an active campaign exploiting two vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-0282 & CVE-2025-0283, impacting Ivanti Connect Secure VPN appliances. They observed the known SPAWN ecosystem of malware but also new families DRYHOOK & PHASEJAM. https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T01:50:22.928Z ##

@jerry Ivanti zero-day mega-toot:

  • Ivanti blog post: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways
  • Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283)
  • U.S. CISA mitigation guidance: CISA Mitigation Instructions for CVE-2025-0282
  • Mandiant observed post-exploitation activity and forensics (includes IOC, Yara): Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation

Government security advisories:

  • U.S.: Ivanti Releases Security Updates for Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways; CISA Adds One Vulnerability to the KEV Catalog
  • Canada: Ivanti security advisory (AV25-008)
  • UK: Active exploitation of vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure

Regular infosec news reporting:

  • Security Week: Ivanti Warns of New Zero-Day Attacks Hitting Connect Secure Product
  • The Record: Ivanti warns hackers are exploiting new vulnerability
  • Bleeping Computer: Ivanti warns of new Connect Secure flaw used in zero-day attacks

  • Security Advisory EPM January 2025 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022 SU6

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-01-08T23:00:46.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2025-0282
Vendor: Ivanti
Product: Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways
Date Added: 2025-01-08
Vulnerability: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways Stack-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Notes: https://www.cisa.gov/cisa-mitigation-instructions-CVE-2025-0282 ; https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-Policy-Secure-ZTA-Gateways-CVE-2025-0282-CVE-2025-0283 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0282
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0282

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T21:07:05.000Z ##

🚨🚨🚨Ivanti, a leading provider of enterprise security solutions, has announced the discovery of two critical zero-day vulnerabilities in its Connect Secure (ICS) product. https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-ivanti-connect-secure-policy-secure-and-neurons-for-zta-gateways

The vulnerabilities, identified as CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283, are currently being actively exploited by malicious actors.

The company released an advisory and a corresponding blog about two bugs — CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283 — and warned that some customers have...

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-08T20:35:03.000Z ##

Ivanti Connect Secure zero-day exploited by attackers (CVE-2025-0282) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2025/01/08/ivanti-exploited-connect-secure-zero-day-cve-2025-0282-cve-2025-0283/ #enterprise #Don'tmiss #Microsoft #Hotstuff #Mandiant #Ivanti #News #VPN

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-08T18:49:02.000Z ##

Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways customers, it's time to upgrade again as there's another two zero days already being exploited in the wild - CVE-2025-0282 and CVE-2025-0283

Unauth code execution.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-Policy-Secure-ZTA-Gateways-CVE-2025-0282-CVE-2025-0283?language=en_US

ASLR prevents buffer overflow attacks, which CVE-2025-0282 is. However only about 5% of binaries in Ivanti's 'secure' Linux appliance have ASLR enabled - a two decade old security control. #yolosec https://infosec.exchange/@wdormann/113794200056523116

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T17:04:23.000Z ##

IVANTI ZERO-DAY: Security Update: Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and Neurons for ZTA Gateways

  • CVE-2025-0282 (9.0 critical) stack-based buffer overflow > unauth RCE
  • CVE-2025-0283 (7.0 high) authenticated LPE

We are aware of a limited number of customers’ Ivanti Connect Secure appliances which have been exploited by CVE-2025-0282 at the time of disclosure.

Check out the Security Advisory Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure & ZTA Gateways (CVE-2025-0282, CVE-2025-0283) for frequently asked questions. cc: @goatyell

#zeroday #ivanti #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #activeexploitation

##

CVE-2024-36504
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:32:01

2 posts

An out-of-bounds read vulnerability [CWE-125] in FortiOS SSLVPN web portal versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.4, versions 7.2.0 through 7.2.8, 7.0 all verisons, and 6.4 all versions may allow an authenticated attacker to perform a denial of service on the SSLVPN web portal via a specially crafted URL.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

CVE-2024-46668
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:03

2 posts

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling vulnerability [CWE-770] in FortiOS versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.4, versions 7.2.0 through 7.2.8, versions 7.0.0 through 7.0.15, and versions 6.4.0 through 6.4.15 may allow an unauthenticated remote user to consume all system memory via multiple large file uploads.

##

CVE-2024-55591
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

18 posts

An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS version 7.0.0 through 7.0.16 and FortiProxy version 7.0.0 through 7.0.19 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.12 allows a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.997Z ##

CISA:

  • CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
  • CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

#fortinet #microsoft #zeroday #cve #vulnerability #eitw #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #cisakev #cisa #infosec #cybersecurity

AAKL at 2025-01-14T19:20:23.401Z ##

New on CISA:

- CVE-2024-55591: Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-55591

- CVE-2025-21333: Microsoft Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Heap-based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-21333

- CVE-2025-21334: Microsoft Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Use-After-Free Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-21334

- CVE-2025-21335: Microsoft Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Use-After-Free Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-21335

- Ivanti Releases Security Updates for Multiple Products https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/14/ivanti-releases-security-updates-multiple-products

- Fortinet Releases Security Updates for Multiple Products https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/14/fortinet-releases-security-updates-multiple-products @cisagov #cybersecurity #infosec #Microsoft #Ivanti #Fortinet

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-14T18:12:42.000Z ##

⚠️ CVE-2024-55591 in FortiOS (Fortigate firewall) is under exploitation by a ransomware operator, they have a copy of an exploit and are using it for initial access and handing off for lateral movement.

https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-535

Impacts Fortigate 7.0.0 through 7.0.16, you need to upgrade if on those versions and check logs for prior exploitation - threat actor had it as a zero day for over a month, I imagine vendor in IR space will drop writeup soon.

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-14T18:10:03.000Z ##

Fortinet fixes FortiOS zero-day exploited by attackers for months (CVE-2024-55591) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2025/01/14/fortinet-fortigate-zero-day-vulnerability-exploited-cve-2024-55591/ #ArcticWolfNetworks #enterprise #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #firewall #Fortinet #0-day #News

##
cert_fr@social.numerique.gouv.fr at 2025-01-14T17:07:08.000Z ##

⚠️Alerte CERT-FR⚠️

CERTFR-2025-ALE-002 : La vulnérabilité CVE-2024-55591 affecte les équipements Fortinet et permet à un attaquant non authentifié de provoquer une exécution de code arbitraire à distance.
Elle est activement exploitée.
https://www.cert.ssi.gouv.fr/alerte/CERTFR-2025-ALE-002/

    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T14:26:32.927Z ##

Happy #ZeroDay from your friends at Fortinet: Authentication bypass in Node.js websocket module
CVE-2024-55591 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical) An Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability [CWE-288] affecting FortiOS and FortiProxy may allow a remote attacker to gain super-admin privileges via crafted requests to Node.js websocket module.

Please note that reports show this is being exploited in the wild.

Indicators of compromise include possible log entries, IP addresses used, and admin accounts created. cc: @GossiTheDog @wdormann @cR0w @briankrebs

#zeroday #patchtuesday #fortinet #vulnerability #CVE_2024_55591 #infosec #ioc #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #fortios #fortiproxy

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T20:18:36.000Z ##

CISA:

  • CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
  • CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog

Just FYI, the Fortinet zero-day was an unexpected announcement today. I would have combined the KEV announcements into a single email but it appears that they staged the original Microsoft zero-days in advance.

  • CVE-2025-21334 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21333 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2025-21335 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-55591 (9.8 critical) Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T19:20:23.000Z ##

New on CISA:

- CVE-2024-55591: Fortinet FortiOS Authorization Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-55591

- CVE-2025-21333: Microsoft Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Heap-based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-21333

- CVE-2025-21334: Microsoft Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Use-After-Free Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-21334

- CVE-2025-21335: Microsoft Windows Hyper-V NT Kernel Integration VSP Use-After-Free Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-21335

- Ivanti Releases Security Updates for Multiple Products https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/14/ivanti-releases-security-updates-multiple-products

- Fortinet Releases Security Updates for Multiple Products https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/01/14/fortinet-releases-security-updates-multiple-products @cisagov #cybersecurity #infosec #Microsoft #Ivanti #Fortinet

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-14T18:12:42.000Z ##

⚠️ CVE-2024-55591 in FortiOS (Fortigate firewall) is under exploitation by a ransomware operator, they have a copy of an exploit and are using it for initial access and handing off for lateral movement.

https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-535

Impacts Fortigate 7.0.0 through 7.0.16, you need to upgrade if on those versions and check logs for prior exploitation - threat actor had it as a zero day for over a month, I imagine vendor in IR space will drop writeup soon.

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-01-14T18:10:03.000Z ##

cert_fr@social.numerique.gouv.fr at 2025-01-14T17:07:08.000Z ##

⚠️Alerte CERT-FR⚠️

CERTFR-2025-ALE-002 : La vulnérabilité CVE-2024-55591 affecte les équipements Fortinet et permet à un attaquant non authentifié de provoquer une exécution de code arbitraire à distance.
Elle est activement exploitée.
https://www.cert.ssi.gouv.fr/alerte/CERTFR-2025-ALE-002/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-50566
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

4 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiManager versions 7.6.0 through 7.6.1, versions 7.4.5 through 7.4.0, and versions 7.2.1 through 7.2.8, FortiManager Cloud versions 7.6.0 through 7.6.1, versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.4, and versions 7.2.2 through 7.2.7 may allow an authenticated remote attacker to execute unauthorized code via

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:58:18.754Z ##

Fortinet big mad about watchTowr: FG-IR-24-463
CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection

This vulnerability was publiclly disclosed by Watchtowr, without following industry standard responsible disclosure process, and advertised via their X account.

Note that to the best of our knowledge, this vulnerability has not been observed to be exploited in the wild.

cc: @GossiTheDog This appears to be #fortijumphigher: watchTowr: Hop-Skip-FortiJump-FortiJump-Higher - Fortinet FortiManager CVE-2024-47575 from 15 November 2024.

#fortinet #fortimanager #cve #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked

  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection

  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##

CVE-2024-50564
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

A use of hard-coded cryptographic key in Fortinet FortiClientWindows version 7.4.0, 7.2.x all versions, 7.0.x all versions, and 6.4.x all versions may allow a low-privileged user to decrypt interprocess communication via monitoring named piped.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI

  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler

  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy

(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy

  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File

  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike

##

CVE-2024-54021
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

An improper neutralization of crlf sequences in http headers ('http response splitting') in Fortinet FortiOS 7.2.0 through 7.6.0, FortiProxy 7.2.0 through 7.4.5 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted HTTP header.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface

##

CVE-2024-46665
(3.7 LOW)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

An insertion of sensitive information into sent data vulnerability [CWE-201] in FortiOS 7.6.0, 7.4.0 through 7.4.4 may allow an attacker in a man-in-the-middle position to retrieve the RADIUS accounting server shared secret via intercepting accounting-requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##
