  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

CVE-2024-33503
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

A improper privilege management in Fortinet FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.3, 7.2.0 through 7.2.5, 7.0.0 through 7.0.12, 6.4.0 through 6.4.14, FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, 7.2.0 through 7.2.5, 7.0.0 through 7.0.12, 6.4.0 through 6.4.14 allows attacker to escalation of privilege via specific shell commands

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI

  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request

  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection

  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon

##

CVE-2024-35275
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') in Fortinet FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 allows attacker to escalation of privilege via specially crafted http requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy

  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File

  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike

updated 2025-01-14T15:31:02

2 posts

A missing authentication for critical function in Fortinet FortiPortal version 6.0.0 through 6.0.15, FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, 7.2.0 through 7.2.5, 7.0.0 through 7.0.12, 6.4.0 through 6.4.14 allows attacker to access to the configuration of the managed devices by sending specifically crafted packets

  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##

CVE-2024-32115
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

2 posts

A relative path traversal vulnerability [CWE-23] in Fortinet FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 and before 7.2.5 allows a privileged attacker to delete files from the underlying filesystem via crafted HTTP or HTTPs requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

CVE-2024-27778
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

2 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS Command vulnerability [CWE-78] in Fortinet FortiSandbox version 4.4.0 through 4.4.4, 4.2.0 through 4.2.6 and below 4.0.4 allows an authenticated attacker with at least read-only permission to execute unauthorized commands via crafted requests.

  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection

  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request

  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service

  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike

##

CVE-2023-42786
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

4 posts

A null pointer dereference in FortiOS versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.1, 7.2.0 through 7.2.5, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions , 6.2 all versions and 6.0 all versions allows attacker to trigger a denial of service via a crafted http request.

##

CVE-2024-21758
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

4 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Fortinet FortiWeb versions 7.2.0 through 7.2.7, and 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 may allow a privileged user to execute arbitrary code via specially crafted CLI commands, provided the user is able to evade FortiWeb stack protections.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature

  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##

CVE-2023-37936
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

4 posts

A use of hard-coded cryptographic key in Fortinet FortiSwitch version 7.4.0 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.7 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.13 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.7 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.7 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

##
cR0w at 2025-01-14T14:23:28.631Z ##

Ooh, is 2025 really going to be the year of hardcoded creds? Fortinet off to a good start with a sev:CRIT in FortiSwitch.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-260

A use of hard-coded cryptographic key vulnerability [CWE-321] in FortiSwitch may allow a remote unauthenticated attacker in posession of the key to execute unauthorized code via crafted cryptographic requests.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37936

Note that the advisory and CVE are dated for today but it's a 2023 CVE. 🙃

(6.5 MEDIUM)

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

2 posts

A null pointer dereference in FortiOS versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.1, 7.2.0 through 7.2.5, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions , 6.2 all versions and 6.0 all versions allows attacker to trigger a denial of service via a crafted http request.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##

CVE-2023-46715
(5.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:55

4 posts

An origin validation error [CWE-346] vulnerability in Fortinet FortiOS IPSec VPN version 7.4.0 through 7.4.1 and version 7.2.6 and below allows an authenticated IPSec VPN user with dynamic IP addressing to send (but not receive) packets spoofing the IP of another user via crafted network packets.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-36512
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:54

4 posts

An improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory ('path traversal') in Fortinet FortiManager, FortiAnalyzer 7.4.0 through 7.4.3 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.2 through 7.0.12 and 6.2.10 through 6.2.13 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI

  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon

##
cR0w at 2025-01-14T14:45:54.997Z ##

Okay, one more, but only because it's a ../

https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-152

A relative path traversal vulnerability [CWE-23] in FortiManager & FortiAnalyzer may allow a privileged attacker with super-admin profile and CLI access to write files on the underlying system via crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-36512

You can get the rest of your own Fortinet cringe: https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt

CVE-2023-37937
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:52

4 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSwitch version 7.4.0 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.7 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.13 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.7 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.7 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via the FortiSwitch CLI.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##
cR0w at 2025-01-14T14:25:36.099Z ##

There's also a post-auth command injection in FortiSwitch but that's less fun. It's also a 2023 CVE but dated for publish today.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-258

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSwitch version 7.4.0 and 7.2.0 through 7.2.5 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.7 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.13 and 6.2.0 through 6.2.7 and 6.0.0 through 6.0.7 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via the FortiSwitch CLI.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37937

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked

##

CVE-2024-7095
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T15:30:51

4 posts

On affected platforms running Arista EOS with SNMP configured, if “snmp-server transmit max-size” is configured, under some circumstances a specially crafted packet can cause the snmpd process to leak memory. This may result in the snmpd process being terminated (causing SNMP requests to time out until snmpd is restarted) and memory pressure for other processes on the switch. Increased memory pres

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-11T10:49:14.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface

  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##

CVE-2024-46667
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:15:26.370000

2 posts

A allocation of resources without limits or throttling in Fortinet FortiSIEM 5.3 all versions, 5.4 all versions, 6.x all versions, 7.0 all versions, and 7.1.0 through 7.1.5 may allow an attacker to deny valid TLS traffic via consuming all allotted connections.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

##

CVE-2024-23106
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:15:14.253000

4 posts

An improper restriction of excessive authentication attempts [CWE-307] in FortiClientEMS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.4 and before 7.0.10 allows an unauthenticated attacker to try a brute force attack against the FortiClientEMS console via crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

Have a few more Fortinet advisories anyway, as a treat.

CVE-2023-42786: https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-293

CVE-2023-46715: https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-407

CVE-2024-21758: https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-458

CVE-2024-23106: https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-476

##

CVE-2023-37931
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T15:15:11.440000

4 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') vulnerability [CWE-88] in FortiVoice Entreprise version 7.0.0 through 7.0.1 and before 6.4.8 allows an authenticated attacker to perform a blind sql injection attack via sending crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

While we're on the topic of 2023 Fortinet CVEs published today, here's a sev:HIGH SQLi in FortiVoice.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-220

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') vulnerability [CWE-88] in FortiVoice Entreprise may allow an authenticated attacker to perform a blind sql injection attack via sending crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37931

CVE-2024-52967
(3.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:33.967000

2 posts

An improper neutralization of script-related html tags in a web page (basic xss) in Fortinet FortiPortal 6.0.0 through 6.0.14 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via html injection.

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

CVE-2024-48886
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:33.027000

2 posts

  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface

    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!

##

CVE-2024-48884
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:32.873000

2 posts

A improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory ('path traversal') in Fortinet FortiManager versions 7.6.0 through 7.6.1, 7.4.1 through 7.4.3, FortiOS versions 7.6.0, 7.4.0 through 7.4.4, 7.2.5 through 7.2.9, 7.0.0 through 7.0.15, 6.4.0 through 6.4.15, FortiProxy 7.4.0 through 7.4.5, 7.2.0 through 7.2.11, 7.0.0 through 7.0.18, 2.0.0 through 2.0.14, 1.2.0 through 1.2.13, 1.1.0 through

##

CVE-2024-46670
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:32.243000

4 posts

An Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability [CWE-125] in FortiOS version 7.6.0, version 7.4.4 and below, version 7.2.9 and below and FortiSASE FortiOS tenant version 24.3.b IPsec IKE service may allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to trigger memory consumption leading to Denial of Service via crafted requests.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-14T15:11:24.000Z ##

The FortiGate issue has an advisory now: https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-266

And a CVE: CVE-2024-46670

Found by some guys at QI-ANXIN Group

There’s some eye raising stuff in it but anyhoo, patch. You probably already are since the patches were released a while ago.

It doesn’t need management interface access, if you can send IKE packets you can send one which triggers the firewall to consume 90% RAM and fail open some traffic and/or crash.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-14T15:11:24.000Z ##

The FortiGate issue has an advisory now: https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-266

And a CVE: CVE-2024-46670

Found by some guys at QI-ANXIN Group

There’s some eye raising stuff in it but anyhoo, patch. You probably already are since the patches were released a while ago.

It doesn’t need management interface access, if you can send IKE packets you can send one which triggers the firewall to consume 90% RAM and fail open some traffic and/or crash.

##

CVE-2024-46669
(3.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:32.100000

2 posts

An Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability [CWE-190] in version 7.4.4 and below, version 7.2.10 and below; FortiSASE version 23.4.b FortiOS tenant IPsec IKE service may allow an authenticated attacker to crash the IPsec tunnel via crafted requests, resulting in potential denial of service.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection

  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike

  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS

(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:31.647000

2 posts

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling [CWE-770] vulnerability in FortiOS versions 7.6.0, versions 7.4.4 through 7.4.0, 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions may allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to prevent access to the GUI via specially crafted requests directed at specific endpoints.

##

CVE-2024-35273
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T14:15:29.663000

2 posts

A out-of-bounds write in Fortinet FortiManager version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 allows attacker to escalation of privilege via specially crafted http requests.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion

  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-56841
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-01-14T11:15:17.020000

2 posts

A vulnerability has been identified in Mendix LDAP (All versions < V1.1.2). Affected versions of the module are vulnerable to LDAP injection. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to bypass username verification.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T13:55:23.538Z ##

Well that doesn't seem ideal. Critical LDAP injection in Siemens Mendix LDAP modules. Kind of seems like one of those "you had one job things" but then I look at firewalls, VPN concentrators, etc.

https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/html/ssa-314390.html

A vulnerability has been identified in Mendix LDAP (All versions < V1.1.2). Affected versions of the module are vulnerable to LDAP injection. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to bypass username verification.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56841

#patchTuesday

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T13:55:23.000Z ##

Well that doesn't seem ideal. Critical LDAP injection in Siemens Mendix LDAP modules. Kind of seems like one of those "you had one job things" but then I look at firewalls, VPN concentrators, etc.

https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/html/ssa-314390.html

A vulnerability has been identified in Mendix LDAP (All versions < V1.1.2). Affected versions of the module are vulnerable to LDAP injection. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to bypass username verification.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56841

##

CVE-2025-0061
(8.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T03:31:48

2 posts

SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform session hijacking over the network without any user interaction, due to an information disclosure vulnerability. Attacker can access and modify all the data of the application.

cR0w at 2025-01-14T01:57:51.932Z ##

Looks like Patch Tuesday started for SAP. Here are a couple sev:HIGH and a couple sev:CRIT CVEs for those interested:

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0061

SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform session hijacking over the network without any user interaction, due to an information disclosure vulnerability. Attacker can access and modify all the data of the application.

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0063

SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP and ABAP Platform does not check for authorization when a user executes some RFC function modules. This could lead to an attacker with basic user privileges to gain control over the data in Informix database, leading to complete compromise of confidentiality, integrity and availability.

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0066

Under certain conditions SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform (Internet Communication Framework) allows an attacker to access restricted information due to weak access controls. This can have a significant impact on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an application

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0070

SAP NetWeaver Application Server for ABAP and ABAP Platform allows an authenticated attacker to obtain illegitimate access to the system by exploiting improper authentication checks, resulting in privilege escalation. On successful exploitation, this can result in potential security concerns. This results in a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

I don't have any more details without a login and I'm on mobile and, most importantly, I don't care enough to log on until tomorrow. Good luck and Happy Patch Tuesday. 🍻

#patchTuesday

updated 2025-01-14T03:31:47

The Event Monster – Event Management, Tickets Booking, Upcoming Event plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.3 via the Visitors List Export file. During the export, a CSV file is created in the wp-content folder with a hardcoded filename that is publicly accessible. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract data ab

CVE-2024-12398
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-14T02:15:07.990000

2 posts

An improper privilege management vulnerability in the web management interface of the Zyxel WBE530 firmware versions through 7.00(ACLE.3) and WBE660S firmware versions through 6.70(ACGG.2) could allow an authenticated user with limited privileges to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator, enabling them to upload configuration files to a vulnerable device.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T19:30:33.396Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Zyxel: Zyxel security advisory for improper privilege management vulnerability in APs and security router devices
CVE-2024-12398 (8.8 high) An improper privilege management vulnerability in the web management interface of the Zyxel WBE530 firmware versions through 7.00(ACLE.3) and WBE660S firmware versions through 6.70(ACGG.2) could allow an authenticated user with limited privileges to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator, enabling them to upload configuration files to a vulnerable device.

There is no mention of exploitation.

CVE-2023-48365
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.66%

updated 2025-01-14T02:00:02.073000

6 posts

Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows before August 2023 Patch 2 allows unauthenticated remote code execution, aka QB-21683. Due to improper validation of HTTP headers, a remote attacker is able to elevate their privilege by tunneling HTTP requests, allowing them to execute HTTP requests on the backend server that hosts the repository application. The fixed versions are August 2023 Patch 2, May 2023 P

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-01-13T16:06:01.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2023-48365
Vendor: Qlik
Product: Sense
Date Added: 2025-01-13
Vulnerability: Qlik Sense HTTP Tunneling Vulnerability
Notes: https://community.qlik.com/t5/Official-Support-Articles/Critical-Security-fixes-for-Qlik-Sense-Enterprise-for-Windows/tac-p/2120510 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48365
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48365

##
AAKL at 2025-01-13T15:34:33.140Z ##

CISA has updated the KEV catalogue:

- CVE-2024-12686: BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) OS Command Injection Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-12686

- CVE-2023-48365: Qlik Sense HTTP Tunneling Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-48365 @cisagov #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T15:26:33.427Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2023-48365 (NVD: 9.9 critical) Qlik Sense HTTP Tunneling Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-12686 (6.6 medium) BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) OS Command Injection Vulnerability

See previous toot for Qlik exploitation evidence. BeyondTrust didn't identify CVE-2024-12686 being exploited in the wild in their security advisory.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T01:57:51.000Z ##

Looks like Patch Tuesday started for SAP. Here are a couple sev:HIGH and a couple sev:CRIT CVEs for those interested:

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0061

SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform session hijacking over the network without any user interaction, due to an information disclosure vulnerability. Attacker can access and modify all the data of the application.

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0063

SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP and ABAP Platform does not check for authorization when a user executes some RFC function modules. This could lead to an attacker with basic user privileges to gain control over the data in Informix database, leading to complete compromise of confidentiality, integrity and availability.

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0066

Under certain conditions SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform (Internet Communication Framework) allows an attacker to access restricted information due to weak access controls. This can have a significant impact on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an application

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0070

SAP NetWeaver Application Server for ABAP and ABAP Platform allows an authenticated attacker to obtain illegitimate access to the system by exploiting improper authentication checks, resulting in privilege escalation. On successful exploitation, this can result in potential security concerns. This results in a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

I don't have any more details without a login and I'm on mobile and, most importantly, I don't care enough to log on until tomorrow. Good luck and Happy Patch Tuesday. 🍻

#patchTuesday

##

CVE-2025-0066
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-14T01:15:16.783000

4 posts

Under certain conditions SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform (Internet Communication Framework) allows an attacker to access restricted information due to weak access controls. This can have a significant impact on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an application

cR0w at 2025-01-14T15:48:52.191Z ##

@da_667 @halva @puppygirlhornypost2 Any bets on if either of these are just as trivial? I haven't looked for any PoCs yet.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0070

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0066

##
cR0w at 2025-01-14T01:57:51.932Z ##

Looks like Patch Tuesday started for SAP. Here are a couple sev:HIGH and a couple sev:CRIT CVEs for those interested:

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0061

SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform session hijacking over the network without any user interaction, due to an information disclosure vulnerability. Attacker can access and modify all the data of the application.

High: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0063

SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP and ABAP Platform does not check for authorization when a user executes some RFC function modules. This could lead to an attacker with basic user privileges to gain control over the data in Informix database, leading to complete compromise of confidentiality, integrity and availability.

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0066

Under certain conditions SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform (Internet Communication Framework) allows an attacker to access restricted information due to weak access controls. This can have a significant impact on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an application

Critical: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0070

SAP NetWeaver Application Server for ABAP and ABAP Platform allows an authenticated attacker to obtain illegitimate access to the system by exploiting improper authentication checks, resulting in privilege escalation. On successful exploitation, this can result in potential security concerns. This results in a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

CVE-2025-0242
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T22:15:15.420000

1 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 133, Thunderbird 133, Firefox ESR 115.18, Firefox ESR 128.5, Thunderbird 115.18, and Thunderbird 128.5. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Firefox ESR < 115.19, Thunderbird < 1

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T16:34:44.000Z ##

Patch your Firefox and Thunderbird: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2025-01/

CVE-2025-0242 and CVE-2025-0247 are sev:HIGH memory safety bugs.

##

CVE-2024-52935
(4.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T21:31:55

2 posts

Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest's virtualised GPU memory.

cR0w at 2025-01-13T15:02:11.022Z ##

There we go, reader mode, FTW.

CVE-2024-52938: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to subvert reconstruction activities to trigger a write of data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52937: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52936: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52935: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47895: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47894: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.

CVE-2025-23108
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T18:33:02

2 posts

Opening Javascript links in a new tab via long-press in the Firefox iOS client could result in a malicious script spoofing the URL of the new tab. This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 134.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-11T15:18:18.686Z ##

Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2025-06 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox for iOS 134
Mozilla has the audacity to drop a security advisory early Saturday morning and call it Friday night's release. They get a pass this time because they're headquartered in San Francisco CA (GMT-8 or Pacific time zone) and their state is on fire. Two CVEs patched:

  • CVE-2025-23108 (moderate) Firefox Mobile iOS Full Address Bar Spoof Using Open in New Tab and Javascript URI
  • CVE-2025-23109 (moderate) Address bar spoofing on iOS using long hostnames

No mention of exploitation

#mozilla #firefox #ios #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-11T15:18:18.000Z ##

updated 2025-01-13T18:32:01

6 posts

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-14T05:50:58.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-5743 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-5743/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_5743

##
cR0w at 2025-01-13T18:44:22.835Z ##

I like me some critical RCE in Internet connected shit, especially when it's from companies like ABB, but something seems odd to me on this one so I hope I'm just reading it wrong.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-5743

An attacker could exploit the 'Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort' vulnerability in EveHome Eve Play to execute arbitrary code. This issue affects Eve Play: through 1.1.42.

sev:CRIT 9.8 CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

So it's RCE because of a bad password hash? And it's AV:N? It seems like there's a step missing in there, doesn't it? Like a disclosure bug or something?

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:44:22.000Z ##

I like me some critical RCE in Internet connected shit, especially when it's from companies like ABB, but something seems odd to me on this one so I hope I'm just reading it wrong.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-5743

An attacker could exploit the 'Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort' vulnerability in EveHome Eve Play to execute arbitrary code. This issue affects Eve Play: through 1.1.42.

sev:CRIT 9.8 CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

So it's RCE because of a bad password hash? And it's AV:N? It seems like there's a step missing in there, doesn't it? Like a disclosure bug or something?

##

CVE-2025-23109
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T18:15:22.903000

2 posts

Long hostnames in URLs could be leveraged to obscure the actual host of the website or spoof the website address This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 134.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-11T15:18:18.686Z ##

Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2025-06 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox for iOS 134
Mozilla has the audacity to drop a security advisory early Saturday morning and call it Friday night's release. They get a pass this time because they're headquartered in San Francisco CA (GMT-8 or Pacific time zone) and their state is on fire. Two CVEs patched:

  • CVE-2025-23108 (moderate) Firefox Mobile iOS Full Address Bar Spoof Using Open in New Tab and Javascript URI
  • CVE-2025-23109 (moderate) Address bar spoofing on iOS using long hostnames

No mention of exploitation

#mozilla #firefox #ios #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-11T15:18:18.000Z ##

Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2025-06 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox for iOS 134
Mozilla has the audacity to drop a security advisory early Saturday morning and call it Friday night's release. They get a pass this time because they're headquartered in San Francisco CA (GMT-8 or Pacific time zone) and their state is on fire. Two CVEs patched:

  • CVE-2025-23108 (moderate) Firefox Mobile iOS Full Address Bar Spoof Using Open in New Tab and Javascript URI
  • CVE-2025-23109 (moderate) Address bar spoofing on iOS using long hostnames

No mention of exploitation

#mozilla #firefox #ios #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-47894
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-13T18:15:18.693000

2 posts

Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest's virtualised GPU memory.

cR0w at 2025-01-13T15:02:11.022Z ##

There we go, reader mode, FTW.

CVE-2024-52938: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to subvert reconstruction activities to trigger a write of data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52937: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52936: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52935: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47895: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47894: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.
