CVE-2021-30184
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.35%

updated 2025-01-12T21:30:21

2 posts

GNU Chess 6.2.7 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted PGN (Portable Game Notation) data. This is related to a buffer overflow in the use of a .tmp.epd temporary file in the cmd_pgnload and cmd_pgnreplay functions in frontend/cmd.cc.

chris_bloke@mastodon.acm.org at 2025-01-12T19:37:59.000Z ##

From 2021, but only just saw it.

> CVE-2021-30184
> GNU Chess 6.2.7 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted PGN (Portable Game Notation) data.

Reminds me of Wargames - "strange game, the only way to win is not to play - how about a nice game of chess?" ♟️

Maybe Joshua was playing the long game against us? 😉

CVE-2024-12404
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-11T03:30:40

2 posts

The CF Internal Link Shortcode plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'post_title' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.0 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries tha

1 repos

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-12404

random_robbie at 2025-01-14T12:54:17.163Z ##

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-12404

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2025-01-10T20:15:30.150000

3 posts

NETGEAR DGN1000 before 1.1.00.48 is vulnerable to an authentication bypass vulnerability. A remote and unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary operating system commands as root by sending crafted HTTP requests to the setup.cgi endpoint. This vulnerability has been exploited in the wild since at least 2017.

##

CVE-2025-22152
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-10T16:15:29.910000

2 posts

Atheos is a self-hosted browser-based cloud IDE. Prior to v600, the $path and $target parameters are not properly validated across multiple components, allowing an attacker to read, modify, or execute arbitrary files on the server. These vulnerabilities can be exploited through various attack vectors present in multiple PHP files. This vulnerability is fixed in v600.

cR0w at 2025-01-10T15:52:28.909Z ##

I don't know WTF Atheos is ( it says it's "A self-hosted browser-based cloud IDE, updated from Codiad IDE" ) but since someone was jonesing for a ../ yesterday, here's a sev:CRIT for you: https://github.com/Atheos/Atheos/security/advisories/GHSA-rgjm-6p59-537v

The $path and $target parameters are not properly validated across multiple components, allowing an attacker to read, modify, or execute arbitrary files on the server. These vulnerabilities can be exploited through various attack vectors present in multiple PHP files.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22152

And I don't have time to edit a new gif right now so here's Taylor Swift demonstrating how to traverse those directories up the path to find the web shell.

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-10T15:52:28.000Z ##

I don't know WTF Atheos is ( it says it's "A self-hosted browser-based cloud IDE, updated from Codiad IDE" ) but since someone was jonesing for a ../ yesterday, here's a sev:CRIT for you: https://github.com/Atheos/Atheos/security/advisories/GHSA-rgjm-6p59-537v

The $path and $target parameters are not properly validated across multiple components, allowing an attacker to read, modify, or execute arbitrary files on the server. These vulnerabilities can be exploited through various attack vectors present in multiple PHP files.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22152

2 posts

CVE-2025-23016
(9.4 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-10T12:30:42

2 posts

FastCGI fcgi2 (aka fcgi) 2.x through 2.4.4 has an integer overflow (and resultant heap-based buffer overflow) via crafted nameLen or valueLen values in data to the IPC socket. This occurs in ReadParams in fcgiapp.c.

cR0w at 2025-01-10T14:07:22.760Z ##

I just came across some FastCGI the other day. Looks like there's a critical int overflow in it: https://github.com/FastCGI-Archives/fcgi2/issues/67

FastCGI fcgi2 (aka fcgi) 2.x through 2.4.4 has an integer overflow (and resultant heap-based buffer overflow) via crafted nameLen or valueLen values in data to the IPC socket. This occurs in ReadParams in fcgiapp.c.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23016

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-10T14:07:22.000Z ##

I just came across some FastCGI the other day. Looks like there's a critical int overflow in it: https://github.com/FastCGI-Archives/fcgi2/issues/67

FastCGI fcgi2 (aka fcgi) 2.x through 2.4.4 has an integer overflow (and resultant heap-based buffer overflow) via crafted nameLen or valueLen values in data to the IPC socket. This occurs in ReadParams in fcgiapp.c.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23016

CVE-2025-21380
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-09T23:15:08.340000

4 posts

Improper access control in Azure SaaS Resources allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network.

AAKL at 2025-01-10T15:54:12.979Z ##

Posted yesterday, Microsoft security updates, two critical January entries https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide

- CVE-2025-21380 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21380
- CVE-2025-21385 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21385 #Microsoft #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T23:31:27.965Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories 09 January 2025:

  • CVE-2025-21380 (8.8 high) Azure Marketplace SaaS Resources Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    • Improper access control in Azure SaaS Resources allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network. (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)
  • CVE-2025-21385 (8.8 high) Microsoft Purview Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    • A Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Microsoft Purview allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network. (CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF))

Not publicly disclosed, not exploited, Exploitability assessment N/A.

#microsoft #msrc #azure #purview #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-10T15:54:12.000Z ##

- CVE-2025-21385 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-21385 #Microsoft #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T23:31:27.000Z ##

  • CVE-2025-21380 (8.8 high) Azure Marketplace SaaS Resources Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    • Improper access control in Azure SaaS Resources allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network. (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)
  • CVE-2025-21385 (8.8 high) Microsoft Purview Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    • A Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Microsoft Purview allows an authorized attacker to disclose information over a network. (CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF))

Not publicly disclosed, not exploited, Exploitability assessment N/A.

##

CVE-2025-21598
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-01-09T21:31:40

4 posts

An Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved's routing protocol daemon (rpd) allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to send malformed BGP packets to a device configured with packet receive trace options enabled to crash rpd. This issue affects: Junos OS:  * from 21.2R3-S8 before 21.2R3-S9,  * from 21.4R3-S7 before 21.4R3-S9,  * from

screaminggoat at 2025-01-10T17:03:30.247Z ##

Juniper security advisory 08 January 2025: 2025-01 Security Bulletin: Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved: When BGP traceoptions are configured, receipt of malformed BGP packets causes RPD to crash (CVE-2025-21598)
CVE-2025-21598 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5, v4.0: 8.2 high) An Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved's routing protocol daemon (rpd) allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to send malformed BGP packets to a device configured with packet receive trace options enabled to crash rpd.
Multiple requirements are listed in the advisory for exposure to this vulnerability. Disabling packet tracing options will work around this issue.

Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

#juniper #junos #CVE_2025_21598 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-10T05:54:35.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-21598 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-21598/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_21598

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-10T17:03:30.000Z ##

Juniper security advisory 08 January 2025: 2025-01 Security Bulletin: Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved: When BGP traceoptions are configured, receipt of malformed BGP packets causes RPD to crash (CVE-2025-21598)
CVE-2025-21598 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5, v4.0: 8.2 high) An Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved's routing protocol daemon (rpd) allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to send malformed BGP packets to a device configured with packet receive trace options enabled to crash rpd.
Multiple requirements are listed in the advisory for exposure to this vulnerability. Disabling packet tracing options will work around this issue.

Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

#juniper #junos #CVE_2025_21598 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-10T05:54:35.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-21598 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-21598/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_21598

##

CVE-2024-12806
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T21:15:24.797000

5 posts

A post-authentication absolute path traversal vulnerability in SonicOS management allows a remote attacker to read an arbitrary file.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.372Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

cR0w at 2025-01-09T23:21:50.199Z ##

@xnyhps there are three more SonicWall advisories:

  • SNWLID-2025-0001 CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 medium) SSL-VPN MFA Bypass Due to UPN and SAM Account Handling in Microsoft AD
  • SNWLID-2025-0004 SonicOS Multiple Post-authentication Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-12803 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12805 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication format string vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication arbitrary file read vulnerability
  • SNWLID-2024-0013 CVE-2024-40765 (5.3 medium) Integer-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability In SonicOS via IPSec

Two of the advisories mention "There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild" but the SSL-VPN MFA Bypass one does not. 🤔

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:37:07.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from SonicWall: SonicOS Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-40762 (7.1 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
  • CVE-2024-53704 (8.2 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 medium) SonicOS SSH Management Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53706 (7.8 high) Gen7 SonicOS Cloud NSv SSH Config Function Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild.

h/t: @xnyhps

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
xnyhps@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:33:13.000Z ##

https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2025-0003 advisory is posted. This covers CVE-2024-40762, CVE-2024-53704, CVE-2024-53705 and CVE-2024-53706.

#vulnerability #sonicwall #cve

(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:32:57

4 posts

A Server-Side Request Forgery vulnerability in the SonicOS SSH management interface allows a remote attacker to establish a TCP connection to an IP address on any port when the user is logged in to the firewall.

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from SonicWall: SonicOS Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-40762 (7.1 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
  • CVE-2024-53704 (8.2 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 medium) SonicOS SSH Management Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53706 (7.8 high) Gen7 SonicOS Cloud NSv SSH Config Function Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

CVE-2024-12803
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:32:57

3 posts

A post-authentication stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in SonicOS management allows a remote attacker to crash a firewall and potentially leads to code execution.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.372Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

3 posts

An Integer-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS via IPSec allows a remote attacker in specific conditions to cause Denial of Service (DoS) and potentially execute arbitrary code by sending a specially crafted IKEv2 payload.

cR0w at 2025-01-09T15:04:08.137Z ##

That's a bunch of vulns there in Iocharger AC charging stations, including 10 criticals: https://csirt.divd.nl/cases/DIVD-2024-00035/

The vendor reports that firmware version 24120701 fixes 13 of these vulnerabilities, and version 25010801 which fixes another 3. One vulnerability is currently still being fixed by the vendor.

CVE-2024-43662
CVE-2024-43663

##

CVE-2024-53704
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:18.640000

7 posts

An Improper Authentication vulnerability in the SSLVPN authentication mechanism allows a remote attacker to bypass authentication.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.372Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2025-01-09T10:40:02.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2025-01-09T10:40:02.000Z ##

Patchez votre firewall SonicWall – CVE-2024-53704 : une faille a été découverte dans le VPN SSL ! https://www.it-connect.fr/firewall-sonicwall-cve-2024-53704-faille-vpn-ssl/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité #SonicWall

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:37:07.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from SonicWall: SonicOS Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-40762 (7.1 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
  • CVE-2024-53704 (8.2 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 medium) SonicOS SSH Management Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53706 (7.8 high) Gen7 SonicOS Cloud NSv SSH Config Function Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild.

h/t: @xnyhps

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
xnyhps@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:33:13.000Z ##

https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2025-0003 advisory is posted. This covers CVE-2024-40762, CVE-2024-53704, CVE-2024-53705 and CVE-2024-53706.

#vulnerability #sonicwall #cve

##
adulau@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T12:44:48.000Z ##

Sonicwall (SonicOS) vulnerabilities.

SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability. CVE-2024-53704 sounds not very good but the others seem quite critical too.

Bundle created in @vulnerability_lookup from a imgur reference.

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:18.173000

2 posts

There are many buffer overflow vulnerabilities present in several CGI binaries of the charging station.This issue affects Iocharger firmware for AC model chargers beforeversion 24120701. Likelihood: High – Given the prevalence of these buffer overflows, and the clear error message of the web server, an attacker is very likely to be able to find these vulnerabilities. Impact: Low – Usually, overf

The vendor reports that firmware version 24120701 fixes 13 of these vulnerabilities, and version 25010801 which fixes another 3. One vulnerability is currently still being fixed by the vendor.

CVE-2024-43661
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:17.937000

2 posts

The <redacted>.so library, which is used by <redacted>, is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the code that handles the deletion of certificates. This buffer overflow can be triggered by providing a long file path to the <redacted> action of the <redacted>.exe CGI binary or to the <redacted>.sh CGI script. This binary or script will write this file path to <redacted>, which is then read by <redact

The CGI script <redacted>.sh can be used to download any file on the filesystem. This issue affects Iocharger firmware for AC model chargers beforeversion 24120701. ##

CVE-2024-40762
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:15.370000

4 posts

Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG) in the SonicOS SSLVPN authentication token generator that, in certain cases, can be predicted by an attacker potentially resulting in authentication bypass.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.372Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:37:07.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from SonicWall: SonicOS Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-40762 (7.1 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
  • CVE-2024-53704 (8.2 high) SonicOS SSLVPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 medium) SonicOS SSH Management Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-53706 (7.8 high) Gen7 SonicOS Cloud NSv SSH Config Function Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild.

h/t: @xnyhps

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
xnyhps@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T20:33:13.000Z ##

https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2025-0003 advisory is posted. This covers CVE-2024-40762, CVE-2024-53704, CVE-2024-53705 and CVE-2024-53706.

#vulnerability #sonicwall #cve

##

CVE-2024-12805
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:15.060000

3 posts

A post-authentication format string vulnerability in SonicOS management allows a remote attacker to crash a firewall and potentially leads to code execution.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.372Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T21:51:44.000Z ##

@xnyhps there are three more SonicWall advisories:

  • SNWLID-2025-0001 CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 medium) SSL-VPN MFA Bypass Due to UPN and SAM Account Handling in Microsoft AD
  • SNWLID-2025-0004 SonicOS Multiple Post-authentication Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-12803 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12805 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication format string vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication arbitrary file read vulnerability
  • SNWLID-2024-0013 CVE-2024-40765 (5.3 medium) Integer-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability In SonicOS via IPSec

Two of the advisories mention "There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild" but the SSL-VPN MFA Bypass one does not. 🤔

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-12802
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T15:15:14.683000

3 posts

SSL-VPN MFA Bypass in SonicWALL SSL-VPN can arise in specific cases due to the separate handling of UPN (User Principal Name) and SAM (Security Account Manager) account names when integrated with Microsoft Active Directory, allowing MFA to be configured independently for each login method and potentially enabling attackers to bypass MFA by exploiting the alternative account name.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T18:39:09.372Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of January 6, 2025
See parent toots above. Last week, SonicWall downplayed the severity of their vulnerabilities. The following CVEs were scored by CISA (ADP) as 9.8 critical:

  • CVE-2024-53704 (vendor scored 8.2)
  • CVE-2024-40765 (vendor scored 5.3)
  • CVE-2024-40762 (vendor scored 7.1)
  • CVE-2024-12805 (vendor scored 6.0)
  • CVE-2024-12803 (vendor scored 6.0)

These include supposedly post-authentication vulnerabilities and yet CISA vectors them as no privileges required (PR:N). The rest of the scores:

  • CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 > 9.1 critical)
  • CVE-2024-53705 (6.5 > 7.5)
  • CVE-2024-53706 (stays 7.8)
  • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 > 7.5)

Now I know better than to trust Sonicwall's CVSS scoring.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T21:51:44.000Z ##

@xnyhps there are three more SonicWall advisories:

  • SNWLID-2025-0001 CVE-2024-12802 (6.5 medium) SSL-VPN MFA Bypass Due to UPN and SAM Account Handling in Microsoft AD
  • SNWLID-2025-0004 SonicOS Multiple Post-authentication Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-12803 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12805 (6.0 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication format string vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-12806 (4.9 medium) SonicOS Post-authentication arbitrary file read vulnerability
  • SNWLID-2024-0013 CVE-2024-40765 (5.3 medium) Integer-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability In SonicOS via IPSec

Two of the advisories mention "There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild" but the SSL-VPN MFA Bypass one does not. 🤔

##

CVE-2024-12542
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-09T12:31:01

2 posts

The linkID plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check when including the 'phpinfo' function in all versions up to, and including, 0.1.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to read configuration settings and predefined variables on the site's server. The plugin does not need to be activated for the vulnerability to be exploi

1 repos

##

CVE-2025-0247
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T09:32:45

1 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 133 and Thunderbird 133. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T16:34:44.000Z ##

Patch your Firefox and Thunderbird: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2025-01/

CVE-2025-0242 and CVE-2025-0247 are sev:HIGH memory safety bugs.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T09:31:48

1 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 16.4 prior to 17.5.5, starting from 17.6 prior to 17.6.3, and starting from 17.7 prior to 17.7.1. When a user is created via the SAML provider, the external groups setting overrides the external provider configuration. As a result, the user may not be marked as external thereby giving those users access to internal projec

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T16:11:35.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory 08 January 2025: GitLab Patch Release: 17.7.1, 17.6.3, 17.5.5

  • CVE-2025-0194 (6.5 medium) Possible access token exposure in GitLab logs
  • CVE-2024-6324 (4.3 medium) Cyclic reference of epics leads resource exhaustion
  • CVE-2024-12431 (4.3 medium) Unauthorized user can manipulate status of issues in public projects
  • CVE-2024-13041 (4.3 medium) Instance SAML does not respect external_provider configuration

No mention of exploitation

(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-09T06:30:35

1 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 15.7 prior to 17.5.5, starting from 17.6 prior to 17.6.3, and starting from 17.7 prior to 17.7.1. It was possible to trigger a DoS by creating cyclic references between epics.

  • CVE-2025-0194 (6.5 medium) Possible access token exposure in GitLab logs
  • CVE-2024-6324 (4.3 medium) Cyclic reference of epics leads resource exhaustion
  • CVE-2024-12431 (4.3 medium) Unauthorized user can manipulate status of issues in public projects
  • CVE-2024-13041 (4.3 medium) Instance SAML does not respect external_provider configuration

No mention of exploitation

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 131.0.6778.264/.265 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.264 for Linux includes 4 security fixes, including 1 externally reported: CVE-2025-0291 (high severity) Type Confusion in V8. No mention of exploitation

But the advisory was published 28 May 2018: https://smartcardservices.github.io/security/

This issue is fixed in SCSSU-201801. A potential stack based buffer overflow existed in GemaltoKeyHandle.cpp.

CVE-2024-50603
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.96%

updated 2025-01-08T01:15:07.127000

12 posts

An issue was discovered in Aviatrix Controller before 7.1.4191 and 7.2.x before 7.2.4996. Due to the improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS command, an unauthenticated attacker is able to execute arbitrary code. Shell metacharacters can be sent to /v1/api in cloud_type for list_flightpath_destination_instances, or src_cloud_type for flightpath_connection_test.

Nuclei template

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-11T20:00:58.215Z ##

@cR0w probably. I mean, the likelihood of exploitation goes up the easier and more convenient a prevalent vulnerability is. This being a 10.0 means no privileges required, attack complexity is low, no user interaction required, and remotely exploitable. This also had a publicly available proof of concept. The way Wiz described it, cybercriminals are cryptomining with their access.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-11T19:18:59.658Z ##

Wiz: Wiz Research Identifies Exploitation in the Wild of Aviatrix Controller RCE (CVE-2024-50603)
CVE-2024-50603 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳) Aviatrix Controller RCE. Wiz Research identified evidence of successful exploitation of this vulnerability across several cloud environments. Indicators of compromise provided.

When deployed in AWS cloud environments, Aviatrix Controller allows privilege escalation by default

cc: @todb @cR0w

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T14:48:40.000Z ##

Does anyone use the Aviatrix Network Controller? I don't know anything about it but a CVSS 10 command injection in a network controller seems a bit yikes. Advisory and CVE published yesterday so I may be slow to this one.

A vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated user to execute arbitrary command against Aviatrix Controllers. As of January 7, 2025, Aviatrix is not aware of any known exploit activity.

https://docs.aviatrix.com/documentation/latest/release-notices/psirt-advisories/psirt-advisories.html?expand=true#remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-aviatrix-controllers

##

CVE-2025-0218
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-07T21:31:01

2 posts

When batch jobs are executed by pgAgent, a script is created in a temporary directory and then executed. In versions of pgAgent prior to 4.2.3, an insufficiently seeded random number generator is used when generating the directory name, leading to the possibility for a local attacker to pre-create the directory and thus prevent pgAgent from executing jobs, disrupting scheduled tasks.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-08T05:52:27.000Z ##

CVE-2025-0299
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-07T18:31:00

4 posts

A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in code-projects Online Book Shop 1.0. Affected is an unknown function of the file /search_result.php. The manipulation of the argument s leads to sql injection. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2025-22621
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-07T17:15:35.710000

2 posts

In versions 1.0.67 and lower of the Splunk App for SOAR, the Splunk documentation for that app recommended adding the `admin_all_objects` capability to the `splunk_app_soar` role. This addition could lead to improper access control for a low-privileged user that does not hold the “admin“ Splunk roles.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T17:36:16.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (well it is a Tuesday) from Splunk:

  • SVD-2025-0101 Privilege escalation for users who hold the "splunk_app_soar" role in the Splunk App for SOAR
    • CVE-2025-22621 (6.4 medium) Splunk App for SOAR privilege escalation vulnerability
  • SVD-2025-0102 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Add-on for JBoss - January 2025

No mention of exploitation.

#Splunk #soar #jboss #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T17:27:48.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22621 is an interesting one in Splunk app for SOAR.

In versions 1.0.67 and lower of the Splunk App for SOAR, the Splunk documentation for that app recommended adding the admin_all_objects capability to the splunk_app_soar role. This addition could lead to improper access control for a low-privileged user that does not hold the “admin“ Splunk roles.

I'm not sure I remember a CVE for poor recommendations in the documentation.

https://advisory.splunk.com/advisories/SVD-2025-0101

CVE-2024-12252
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-01-07T05:15:16.660000

2 posts

The SEO LAT Auto Post plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to file overwrite due to a missing capability check on the remote_update AJAX action in all versions up to, and including, 2.2.1. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to overwrite the seo-beginner-auto-post.php file which can be leveraged to achieve remote code execution.

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition vulnerability during JSP compilation in Apache Tomcat permits an RCE on case insensitive file systems when the default servlet is enabled for write (non-default configuration). CVE-2024-53677
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-01-03T12:15:26.673000

5 posts

File upload logic in Apache Struts is flawed. An attacker can manipulate file upload params to enable paths traversal and under some circumstances this can lead to uploading a malicious file which can be used to perform Remote Code Execution. This issue affects Apache Struts: from 2.0.0 before 6.4.0. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 6.4.0 at least and migrate to the new file upload m

CVE-2024-46973
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-28T18:31:50

2 posts

Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

cR0w at 2025-01-13T15:02:11.022Z ##

There we go, reader mode, FTW.

CVE-2024-52938: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to subvert reconstruction activities to trigger a write of data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52937: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52936: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52935: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47895: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47894: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.

##

CVE-2024-12856
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-27T18:30:32

2 posts

The Four-Faith router models F3x24 and F3x36 are affected by an operating system (OS) command injection vulnerability. At least firmware version 2.0 allows authenticated and remote attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands over HTTP when modifying the system time via apply.cgi. Additionally, this firmware version has default credentials which, if not changed, would effectively change this vulnera

1 repos

https://github.com/nu113d/CVE-2024-12856

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T20:17:16.484Z ##

QiAnXin: Gayfemboy: A Botnet Deliver Through a Four-Faith Industrial Router 0-day Exploit.
This is certainly a read: QiAnXin's XLAB reports on the Gayfemboy botnet, which is a Mirai variant whose operators are becoming more sophisticated since February 2024 with the inclusion of N-day and now zero-day vulnerabilities such as CVE-2024-12856 (7.2 high) Four-Faith Industrial Router post-auth command injection.

Interestingly, when it detected our registration of its domains, it retaliated immediately with a DDoS attack—an act of notable hostility.

QiAnXin describes the botnet's geographic spread, the exploited vulnerabilities (cc: @todb), analysis of the Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS), and a Gayfemboy sample. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#Gayfemboy #ddos #mirai #botnet #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T20:17:16.000Z ##

QiAnXin: Gayfemboy: A Botnet Deliver Through a Four-Faith Industrial Router 0-day Exploit.
This is certainly a read: QiAnXin's XLAB reports on the Gayfemboy botnet, which is a Mirai variant whose operators are becoming more sophisticated since February 2024 with the inclusion of N-day and now zero-day vulnerabilities such as CVE-2024-12856 (7.2 high) Four-Faith Industrial Router post-auth command injection.

Interestingly, when it detected our registration of its domains, it retaliated immediately with a DDoS attack—an act of notable hostility.

QiAnXin describes the botnet's geographic spread, the exploited vulnerabilities (cc: @todb), analysis of the Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS), and a Gayfemboy sample. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#Gayfemboy #ddos #mirai #botnet #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

CVE-2024-0519
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2024-12-20T19:01:11

2 posts

Out of bounds memory access in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T02:09:44.957Z ##

@zl2tod @jerry Yeah January 2024 was a fun month:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti zero-day CVE-2023-46805 (UNPATCHED): https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024
    • Citrix zero-days CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
    • Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-0519: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
    • Atlassian perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 CVE-2024-22527 https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-server-1333990257.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as a zero-day as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti discloses new zero-day CVE-2024-21887 and releases first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVE-2023-4863
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 54.03%

updated 2024-12-20T19:00:21.050000

4 posts

Heap buffer overflow in libwebp in Google Chrome prior to 116.0.5845.187 and libwebp 1.3.2 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Critical)

11 repos

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!

  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy

  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 42.67%

updated 2024-12-20T18:32:37

2 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T02:09:44.957Z ##

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti zero-day CVE-2023-46805 (UNPATCHED): https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

macOS bug lets hackers install malicious kernel drivers https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/microsoft-macos-bug-lets-hackers-install-malicious-kernel-drivers/ @BleepingComputer @serghei #infosec #Apple #cybersecurity #macOS

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T17:19:49.185Z ##

Microsoft: Analyzing CVE-2024-44243, a macOS System Integrity Protection bypass through kernel extensions
CVE-2024-44243 (CISA CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) security feature bypass. Microsoft describes it as a macOS vulnerability that could allow attackers to bypass Apple's System Integrity Protection (SIP) in macOS by loading third party kernel extensions. SIP is a security technology that restricts the performance of operations that may compromise system integrity. The bypass of SIP could increase the potential for attackers and malware authors to successfully install rootkits, create persistent malware, bypass Transparency, Consent and Control (TCC), and expand the attack surface for additional techniques and exploits. Microsoft provides a root cause analysis of CVE-2024-44243.

#CVE_2024_44243 #SIP #Apple #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #tcc

##
ClubTeleMatique@mstdn.social at 2025-01-14T18:15:44.000Z ##

Hacker News: Microsoft Uncovers macOS Vulnerability CVE-2024-44243 Allowing Rootkit Installation https://thehackernews.com/2025/01/microsoft-uncovers-macos-vulnerability.html #news #IT

Microsoft: Analyzing CVE-2024-44243, a macOS System Integrity Protection bypass through kernel extensions https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2025/01/13/analyzing-cve-2024-44243-a-macos-system-integrity-protection-bypass-through-kernel-extensions/

More:

macOS bug lets hackers install malicious kernel drivers https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/microsoft-macos-bug-lets-hackers-install-malicious-kernel-drivers/ @BleepingComputer @serghei #infosec #Apple #cybersecurity #macOS

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-13T17:19:49.000Z ##

Microsoft: Analyzing CVE-2024-44243, a macOS System Integrity Protection bypass through kernel extensions
CVE-2024-44243 (CISA CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) security feature bypass. Microsoft describes it as a macOS vulnerability that could allow attackers to bypass Apple's System Integrity Protection (SIP) in macOS by loading third party kernel extensions. SIP is a security technology that restricts the performance of operations that may compromise system integrity. The bypass of SIP could increase the potential for attackers and malware authors to successfully install rootkits, create persistent malware, bypass Transparency, Consent and Control (TCC), and expand the attack surface for additional techniques and exploits. Microsoft provides a root cause analysis of CVE-2024-44243.

#CVE_2024_44243 #SIP #Apple #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #tcc

##

CVE-2024-12686
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 3.73%

updated 2024-12-18T21:31:03

7 posts

A vulnerability has been discovered in Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) which can allow an attacker with existing administrative privileges to inject commands and run as a site user.

nikolozk at 2025-01-14T14:02:25.725Z ##

𝗕𝗲𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗧𝗿𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝗘𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲𝘀 𝗧𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝘂𝗿𝘆 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀

State-sponsored threat actors have exploited a stolen BeyondTrust API key to breach U.S. Treasury systems, accessing unclassified workstations and documents.

‣ Impact Scope:
- Treasury Department workstations
- Organizations using BeyondTrust Remote Support SaaS
- Federal systems with similar configurations

‣ Current Status:
- BeyondTrust service taken offline
- API key revoked
- Two critical vulnerabilities identified (CVE-2024-12356, CVE-2024-12686)

‣ Immediate Actions Required:
- Audit API key access and rotation policies
- Review remote support tool configurations
- Monitor for unauthorized access attempts
- Apply available patches immediately

The compromise is yet another demonstration of how a single API key can bypass multiple security layers.

Is your organization regularly auditing and rotating API keys across cloud services?

Enjoyed the post? Follow me for more

You can also join cybersecurity leaders and professionals who receive these insights in my weekly newsletter

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-01-13T16:06:17.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-12686
Vendor: BeyondTrust
Product: Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS)
Date Added: 2025-01-13
Vulnerability: BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) OS Command Injection Vulnerability
Notes: https://www.beyondtrust.com/trust-center/security-advisories/bt24-11 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12686
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-12686

screaminggoat at 2025-01-13T15:26:33.427Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2023-48365 (NVD: 9.9 critical) Qlik Sense HTTP Tunneling Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-12686 (6.6 medium) BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) OS Command Injection Vulnerability

See previous toot for Qlik exploitation evidence. BeyondTrust didn't identify CVE-2024-12686 being exploited in the wild in their security advisory.

CVE-2024-12356
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.30%

updated 2024-12-17T06:30:39

1 posts

A critical vulnerability has been discovered in Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) products which can allow an unauthenticated attacker to inject commands that are run as a site user.

nikolozk at 2025-01-14T14:02:25.725Z ##

𝗕𝗲𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗧𝗿𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗔𝗣𝗜 𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝗘𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲𝘀 𝗧𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝘂𝗿𝘆 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀

State-sponsored threat actors have exploited a stolen BeyondTrust API key to breach U.S. Treasury systems, accessing unclassified workstations and documents.

‣ Impact Scope:
- Treasury Department workstations
- Organizations using BeyondTrust Remote Support SaaS
- Federal systems with similar configurations

‣ Current Status:
- BeyondTrust service taken offline
- API key revoked
- Two critical vulnerabilities identified (CVE-2024-12356, CVE-2024-12686)

‣ Immediate Actions Required:
- Audit API key access and rotation policies
- Review remote support tool configurations
- Monitor for unauthorized access attempts
- Apply available patches immediately

The compromise is yet another demonstration of how a single API key can bypass multiple security layers.

Is your organization regularly auditing and rotating API keys across cloud services?

##

CVE-2024-9681
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-13T15:31:42

4 posts

When curl is asked to use HSTS, the expiry time for a subdomain might overwrite a parent domain's cache entry, making it end sooner or later than otherwise intended. This affects curl using applications that enable HSTS and use URLs with the insecure `HTTP://` scheme and perform transfers with hosts like `x.example.com` as well as `example.com` where the first host is a subdomain of the second ho

eslerm@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-09T19:35:31.000Z ##

@bagder this feels like a CVSS issue. The folks who developed the _severity_ metric know it doesn't do a great job correlating importance, but it's the best we have and FedRAMP and other standards make following it a requirement 🥲

(@zmanion has a talk about the pitfalls of defining CVSS in his talk Desperately Seeking Severity)

CISA scored CVE-2024-9681 slightly lower than NVD (Availability None instead of Low).

Is CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N incorrect?

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2025-01-09T15:04:20.000Z ##

Congratulations all crowd strike users on macOS who now get warnings about the #libcurl version shipped by Apple. May you all enjoy your choices of software vendors.

It alerts about CVE-2024-9681. We said it is severity low. NVD says 6.5 medium.

Never a dull moment.

##
eslerm@cyberplace.social at 2025-01-09T19:35:31.000Z ##

@bagder this feels like a CVSS issue. The folks who developed the _severity_ metric know it doesn't do a great job correlating importance, but it's the best we have and FedRAMP and other standards make following it a requirement 🥲

(@zmanion has a talk about the pitfalls of defining CVSS in his talk Desperately Seeking Severity)

CVE-2024-49113
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-12T03:33:14

15 posts

Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

3 repos

https://github.com/barcrange/CVE-2024-49113-Checker

https://github.com/SafeBreach-Labs/CVE-2024-49113

https://github.com/Sachinart/CVE-2024-49113-Checker

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.778Z ##

Trend Micro: Information Stealer Masquerades as LDAPNightmare (CVE-2024-49113) PoC Exploit
There's a lot of interest in these two vulnerabilities (fixed by Microsoft in December 2024's Patch Tuesday) after SafeBreach published a proof of concept for both CVE-2024-49112 and 49113. A fake PoC masquerading as CVE-2024-9112/49113 now targets security researchers into downloading and executing an information stealer. Trend Micro provides a technical analysis of the infostealer and links to the indicators of compromise.

References:

  • CVE-2024-49112 (9.8 critical, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49113 (7.5 high, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113 #proofofconcept #threatintel #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
decio at 2025-01-04T13:19:28.742Z ##

Résumé de la situation concernant les vulnérabilités CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) & CVE-2024-49112 dans le service LDAP Windows

🔍 Les vulnérabilités en bref

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49112

    • 📝 Type : Exécution de code à distance (RCE)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 9.8
    • 🧑‍💻 Découverte : Par le chercheur en sécurité Yuki Chen, dont les détails précis n'ont pas encore été divulgués (des démonstrations potentielles en conférences infosec à venir).

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49113

    • 📝 Type : Déni de service (DoS)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 7.5
    • 🪪 Surnom : LDAPNightmare (d’après SafeBreach).

💡 Clarifications importantes de Yuki Chen :

  • Le PoC baptisé “LDAPNightmare” par SafeBreach est lié à CVE-2024-49113, et non à CVE-2024-49112.
  • ⚠️ Attention au score CVSS : CVE-2024-49112 a un score élevé (9.8), mais son exploitabilité réelle pourrait être inférieure à d’autres failles corrigées ce mois-ci.

"Here is the ironic side of vuln response based on CVSS score - especially when it comes to binary vulns. Everyone cares about CVE-2024-49112 because MS assigns CVSS 9.8 to this vulnerability, but never forget the score is highly affected by the skills of the analysis team behind."

— Yuki Chen

🔗 Source : Tweet de Yuki Chen

🛡️ Exploitation potentielle de CVE-2024-49112 (méthodes pas encore rendues publiques)

  1. 🎯 Sur un contrôleur de domaine

    • Un attaquant non authentifié envoie des appels RPC spécialement conçus pour forcer un lookup vers son domaine malveillant.
    • Si la cible est un serveur LDAP, la faille permet d’exécuter du code arbitraire dans le contexte du service LDAP.

  2. 👨‍💻 Sur un client LDAP

    • L’attaquant doit tromper la victime afin qu’elle réalise :
      • 🔍 Un lookup de contrôleur de domaine vers un domaine malveillant, ou
      • 🔗 Une connexion directe à un serveur LDAP malveillant.
    • Note : Les appels RPC non authentifiés ne fonctionneront pas.

🔗 Source : TrendMicro

Comment les attaquants peuvent exploiter CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare)

  • 🧪 Proof-of-Concept (PoC) :
    SafeBreach Labs a publié un exploit démontrant qu’un simple paquet CLDAP malveillant peut :
    • ❌ Faire crasher LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service).
    • 🔄 Redémarrer un contrôleur de domaine Windows (ou tout Windows Server vulnérable).
  • 📋 Condition requise :
    • Le serveur DNS du DC ciblé doit pouvoir communiquer avec Internet.
  • ⚙️ Variante RCE :
    SafeBreach a également indiqué qu’une variante de la chaîne d’exploitation pourrait aboutir à un RCE (CVE-2024-49112) en modifiant le paquet CLDAP.

🔗 PoC CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) : GitHub SafeBreach-Labs

🔒 Comment se protéger

  • ✅ Appliquer les correctifs Microsoft du Patch Tuesday de décembre 2024 :
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49112
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49113

#CyberVeille #LDAPNightmare #CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113

##
threatcodex at 2025-01-03T13:45:52.490Z ##

LDAPNightmare: SafeBreach Labs Publishes First Proof-of-Concept Exploit for CVE-2024-49113
#CVE_2024_49113
https://www.safebreach.com/blog/ldapnightmare-safebreach-labs-publishes-first-proof-of-concept-exploit-for-cve-2024-49113/

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.000Z ##

A fake PoC masquerading as CVE-2024-9112/49113 now targets security researchers into downloading and executing an information stealer.   • CVE-2024-49112 (9.8 critical, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49113 (7.5 high, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-04T13:19:28.000Z ##

Résumé de la situation concernant les vulnérabilités CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) & CVE-2024-49112 dans le service LDAP Windows

🔍 Les vulnérabilités en bref

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49112

    • 📝 Type : Exécution de code à distance (RCE)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 9.8
    • 🧑‍💻 Découverte : Par le chercheur en sécurité Yuki Chen, dont les détails précis n'ont pas encore été divulgués (des démonstrations potentielles en conférences infosec à venir).

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49113

    • 📝 Type : Déni de service (DoS)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 7.5
    • 🪪 Surnom : LDAPNightmare (d’après SafeBreach).

💡 Clarifications importantes de Yuki Chen :

  • Le PoC baptisé “LDAPNightmare” par SafeBreach est lié à CVE-2024-49113, et non à CVE-2024-49112.
  • ⚠️ Attention au score CVSS : CVE-2024-49112 a un score élevé (9.8), mais son exploitabilité réelle pourrait être inférieure à d’autres failles corrigées ce mois-ci.

"Here is the ironic side of vuln response based on CVSS score - especially when it comes to binary vulns. Everyone cares about CVE-2024-49112 because MS assigns CVSS 9.8 to this vulnerability, but never forget the score is highly affected by the skills of the analysis team behind."

— Yuki Chen

🔗 Source : Tweet de Yuki Chen

🛡️ Exploitation potentielle de CVE-2024-49112 (méthodes pas encore rendues publiques)

  1. 🎯 Sur un contrôleur de domaine

    • Un attaquant non authentifié envoie des appels RPC spécialement conçus pour forcer un lookup vers son domaine malveillant.
    • Si la cible est un serveur LDAP, la faille permet d’exécuter du code arbitraire dans le contexte du service LDAP.

  2. 👨‍💻 Sur un client LDAP

    • L’attaquant doit tromper la victime afin qu’elle réalise :
      • 🔍 Un lookup de contrôleur de domaine vers un domaine malveillant, ou
      • 🔗 Une connexion directe à un serveur LDAP malveillant.
    • Note : Les appels RPC non authentifiés ne fonctionneront pas.

🔗 Source : TrendMicro

Comment les attaquants peuvent exploiter CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare)

  • 🧪 Proof-of-Concept (PoC) :
    SafeBreach Labs a publié un exploit démontrant qu’un simple paquet CLDAP malveillant peut :
    • ❌ Faire crasher LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service).
    • 🔄 Redémarrer un contrôleur de domaine Windows (ou tout Windows Server vulnérable).
  • 📋 Condition requise :
    • Le serveur DNS du DC ciblé doit pouvoir communiquer avec Internet.
  • ⚙️ Variante RCE :
    SafeBreach a également indiqué qu’une variante de la chaîne d’exploitation pourrait aboutir à un RCE (CVE-2024-49112) en modifiant le paquet CLDAP.

🔗 PoC CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) : GitHub SafeBreach-Labs

🔒 Comment se protéger

  • ✅ Appliquer les correctifs Microsoft du Patch Tuesday de décembre 2024 :
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49112
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49113

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-11T16:20:11.000Z ##

Fake LDAPNightmware exploit on GitHub spreads infostealer malware

A deceptive proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2024-49113 (aka "LDAPNightmare") on GitHub infects users with infostealer malware that...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/kv8fq1

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2025-01-10T23:07:26.000Z ##

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-49113

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2025-01-10T23:05:00.000Z ##

CVE-2024-49113 / 7.5 HIGH

“LDAP Nightmare”, attackers have devised a cunning new strategy to exploit the buzz around this vulnerability. Trend Micro has uncovered malicious repositories masquerading as proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits for the critical Windows vulnerability. These fake PoCs specifically target security researchers, red teamers, and SOC teams, delivering information-stealing malware instead of legitimate testing tools.

IoCs below in the found post:

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jpcastro_soc-redteam-ldapnightmare-activity-7283618784001638401-iYAT?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop

##
AAKL at 2025-01-10T14:45:03.197Z ##

Trend Micro, from yesterday: Information Stealer Masquerades as LDAPNightmare (CVE-2024-49113) PoC Exploit https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/25/a/information-stealer-masquerades-as-ldapnightmare-poc-exploit.html @TrendMicro

More: Fake PoC Exploit Targets Security Researchers with Infostealer https://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/fake-poc-exploit-researchers/ @cybersecurity #infosec

##
AAKL at 2025-01-09T17:24:24.024Z ##

Trend Micro: Information Stealer Masquerades as LDAPNightmare (CVE-2024-49113) PoC Exploit https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/25/a/information-stealer-masquerades-as-ldapnightmare-poc-exploit.html @TrendMicro #cybersecurity #infosec

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-11T16:20:11.000Z ##

Fake LDAPNightmware exploit on GitHub spreads infostealer malware

A deceptive proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2024-49113 (aka "LDAPNightmare") on GitHub infects users with infostealer malware that...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/kv8fq1

verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2025-01-10T23:07:26.000Z ##

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2025-01-10T23:05:00.000Z ##

CVE-2024-49113 / 7.5 HIGH

“LDAP Nightmare”, attackers have devised a cunning new strategy to exploit the buzz around this vulnerability. Trend Micro has uncovered malicious repositories masquerading as proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits for the critical Windows vulnerability. These fake PoCs specifically target security researchers, red teamers, and SOC teams, delivering information-stealing malware instead of legitimate testing tools.

IoCs below in the found post:

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jpcastro_soc-redteam-ldapnightmare-activity-7283618784001638401-iYAT?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop

##

CVE-2024-49112
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-12-12T03:33:14

4 posts

Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

3 repos

https://github.com/bo0l3an/CVE-2024-49112-PoC

https://github.com/CCIEVoice2009/CVE-2024-49112

https://github.com/tnkr/poc_monitor

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.778Z ##

Trend Micro: Information Stealer Masquerades as LDAPNightmare (CVE-2024-49113) PoC Exploit
There's a lot of interest in these two vulnerabilities (fixed by Microsoft in December 2024's Patch Tuesday) after SafeBreach published a proof of concept for both CVE-2024-49112 and 49113. A fake PoC masquerading as CVE-2024-9112/49113 now targets security researchers into downloading and executing an information stealer. Trend Micro provides a technical analysis of the infostealer and links to the indicators of compromise.

References:

  • CVE-2024-49112 (9.8 critical, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49113 (7.5 high, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113 #proofofconcept #threatintel #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
decio at 2025-01-04T13:19:28.742Z ##

Résumé de la situation concernant les vulnérabilités CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) & CVE-2024-49112 dans le service LDAP Windows

🔍 Les vulnérabilités en bref

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49112

    • 📝 Type : Exécution de code à distance (RCE)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 9.8
    • 🧑‍💻 Découverte : Par le chercheur en sécurité Yuki Chen, dont les détails précis n'ont pas encore été divulgués (des démonstrations potentielles en conférences infosec à venir).

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49113

    • 📝 Type : Déni de service (DoS)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 7.5
    • 🪪 Surnom : LDAPNightmare (d’après SafeBreach).

💡 Clarifications importantes de Yuki Chen :

  • Le PoC baptisé “LDAPNightmare” par SafeBreach est lié à CVE-2024-49113, et non à CVE-2024-49112.
  • ⚠️ Attention au score CVSS : CVE-2024-49112 a un score élevé (9.8), mais son exploitabilité réelle pourrait être inférieure à d’autres failles corrigées ce mois-ci.

"Here is the ironic side of vuln response based on CVSS score - especially when it comes to binary vulns. Everyone cares about CVE-2024-49112 because MS assigns CVSS 9.8 to this vulnerability, but never forget the score is highly affected by the skills of the analysis team behind."

— Yuki Chen

🔗 Source : Tweet de Yuki Chen

🛡️ Exploitation potentielle de CVE-2024-49112 (méthodes pas encore rendues publiques)

  1. 🎯 Sur un contrôleur de domaine

    • Un attaquant non authentifié envoie des appels RPC spécialement conçus pour forcer un lookup vers son domaine malveillant.
    • Si la cible est un serveur LDAP, la faille permet d’exécuter du code arbitraire dans le contexte du service LDAP.

  2. 👨‍💻 Sur un client LDAP

    • L’attaquant doit tromper la victime afin qu’elle réalise :
      • 🔍 Un lookup de contrôleur de domaine vers un domaine malveillant, ou
      • 🔗 Une connexion directe à un serveur LDAP malveillant.
    • Note : Les appels RPC non authentifiés ne fonctionneront pas.

🔗 Source : TrendMicro

Comment les attaquants peuvent exploiter CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare)

  • 🧪 Proof-of-Concept (PoC) :
    SafeBreach Labs a publié un exploit démontrant qu’un simple paquet CLDAP malveillant peut :
    • ❌ Faire crasher LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service).
    • 🔄 Redémarrer un contrôleur de domaine Windows (ou tout Windows Server vulnérable).
  • 📋 Condition requise :
    • Le serveur DNS du DC ciblé doit pouvoir communiquer avec Internet.
  • ⚙️ Variante RCE :
    SafeBreach a également indiqué qu’une variante de la chaîne d’exploitation pourrait aboutir à un RCE (CVE-2024-49112) en modifiant le paquet CLDAP.

🔗 PoC CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) : GitHub SafeBreach-Labs

🔒 Comment se protéger

  • ✅ Appliquer les correctifs Microsoft du Patch Tuesday de décembre 2024 :
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49112
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49113

#CyberVeille #LDAPNightmare #CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.000Z ##

A fake PoC masquerading as CVE-2024-9112/49113 now targets security researchers into downloading and executing an information stealer.   • CVE-2024-49112 (9.8 critical, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49113 (7.5 high, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113 #proofofconcept #threatintel #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

decio@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-04T13:19:28.000Z ##

Résumé de la situation concernant les vulnérabilités CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) & CVE-2024-49112 dans le service LDAP Windows

🔍 Les vulnérabilités en bref

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49112

    • 📝 Type : Exécution de code à distance (RCE)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 9.8
    • 🧑‍💻 Découverte : Par le chercheur en sécurité Yuki Chen, dont les détails précis n'ont pas encore été divulgués (des démonstrations potentielles en conférences infosec à venir).

  • ⚡ CVE-2024-49113

    • 📝 Type : Déni de service (DoS)
    • 🔢 Score CVSS : 7.5
    • 🪪 Surnom : LDAPNightmare (d’après SafeBreach).

💡 Clarifications importantes de Yuki Chen :

  • Le PoC baptisé “LDAPNightmare” par SafeBreach est lié à CVE-2024-49113, et non à CVE-2024-49112.
  • ⚠️ Attention au score CVSS : CVE-2024-49112 a un score élevé (9.8), mais son exploitabilité réelle pourrait être inférieure à d’autres failles corrigées ce mois-ci.

"Here is the ironic side of vuln response based on CVSS score - especially when it comes to binary vulns. Everyone cares about CVE-2024-49112 because MS assigns CVSS 9.8 to this vulnerability, but never forget the score is highly affected by the skills of the analysis team behind."

— Yuki Chen

🔗 Source : Tweet de Yuki Chen

🛡️ Exploitation potentielle de CVE-2024-49112 (méthodes pas encore rendues publiques)

  1. 🎯 Sur un contrôleur de domaine

    • Un attaquant non authentifié envoie des appels RPC spécialement conçus pour forcer un lookup vers son domaine malveillant.
    • Si la cible est un serveur LDAP, la faille permet d’exécuter du code arbitraire dans le contexte du service LDAP.

  2. 👨‍💻 Sur un client LDAP

    • L’attaquant doit tromper la victime afin qu’elle réalise :
      • 🔍 Un lookup de contrôleur de domaine vers un domaine malveillant, ou
      • 🔗 Une connexion directe à un serveur LDAP malveillant.
    • Note : Les appels RPC non authentifiés ne fonctionneront pas.

🔗 Source : TrendMicro

Comment les attaquants peuvent exploiter CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare)

  • 🧪 Proof-of-Concept (PoC) :
    SafeBreach Labs a publié un exploit démontrant qu’un simple paquet CLDAP malveillant peut :
    • ❌ Faire crasher LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service).
    • 🔄 Redémarrer un contrôleur de domaine Windows (ou tout Windows Server vulnérable).
  • 📋 Condition requise :
    • Le serveur DNS du DC ciblé doit pouvoir communiquer avec Internet.
  • ⚙️ Variante RCE :
    SafeBreach a également indiqué qu’une variante de la chaîne d’exploitation pourrait aboutir à un RCE (CVE-2024-49112) en modifiant le paquet CLDAP.

🔗 PoC CVE-2024-49113 (LDAPNightmare) : GitHub SafeBreach-Labs

🔒 Comment se protéger

  • ✅ Appliquer les correctifs Microsoft du Patch Tuesday de décembre 2024 :
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49112
    • 🛠 🩹 CVE-2024-49113

##

CVE-2024-43702
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-02T00:35:08

2 posts

Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

cR0w at 2025-01-13T15:02:11.022Z ##

There we go, reader mode, FTW.

CVE-2024-52938: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to subvert reconstruction activities to trigger a write of data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52937: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52936: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-52935: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may exploit memory shared with the GPU Firmware to write data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47895: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47894: Kernel software installed and running inside a Guest VM may post improper commands to the GPU Firmware to read data outside the Guest’s virtualised GPU memory.

CVE-2024-47897: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls resulting in platform instability and reboots.

CVE-2024-46973: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to trigger use-after-free kernel exceptions.

CVE-2024-43703: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to achieve unauthorised reads and writes of physical memory from the GPU HW.

CVE-2024-43702: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to allow unprivileged access to arbitrary physical memory page.

CVE-2024-43705: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user can trigger the GPU kernel driver to write to arbitrary read-only system files that have been mapped into application memory.

##
