CVE-2024-23222
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.13%

updated 2024-11-29T15:05:53.577000

2 posts

A type confusion issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, tvOS 17.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T02:09:44.957Z ##

@zl2tod @jerry Yeah January 2024 was a fun month:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti zero-day CVE-2023-46805 (UNPATCHED): https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024
    • Citrix zero-days CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
    • Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-0519: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
    • Atlassian perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 CVE-2024-22527 https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-server-1333990257.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as a zero-day as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti discloses new zero-day CVE-2024-21887 and releases first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as a zero-day as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti discloses new zero-day CVE-2024-21887 and releases first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVE-2024-9112
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-11-23T03:31:59

2 posts

FastStone Image Viewer PSD File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of FastStone Image Viewer. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of P

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.778Z ##

Trend Micro: Information Stealer Masquerades as LDAPNightmare (CVE-2024-49113) PoC Exploit
There's a lot of interest in these two vulnerabilities (fixed by Microsoft in December 2024's Patch Tuesday) after SafeBreach published a proof of concept for both CVE-2024-49112 and 49113. A fake PoC masquerading as CVE-2024-9112/49113 now targets security researchers into downloading and executing an information stealer. Trend Micro provides a technical analysis of the infostealer and links to the indicators of compromise.

References:

  • CVE-2024-49112 (9.8 critical, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49113 (7.5 high, disclosed by Microsoft 10 December 2024) Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_49112 #CVE_2024_49113 #proofofconcept #threatintel #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T14:44:36.000Z ##

CVE-2023-38198
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.76%

updated 2024-10-30T21:30:36

1 posts

acme.sh before 3.0.6 runs arbitrary commands from a remote server via eval, as exploited in the wild in June 2023.

crits@digitalcourage.social at 2025-01-09T13:37:49.000Z ##

ACME - SECURITY - ALERT

Bitte prüfen Sie, ob Sie ACME Version > 3.0.6 verwenden.
Sofern nicht, so aktualisieren Sie acme.sh bitte umgehend:

Melden Sie sich dazu als acme-user an:

sudo -s
su - acmeuser

Führen Sie dann folgenden Befehl aus:

acme.sh --upgrade --auto-upgrade

Verlassen Sie, "Upgrade success" vorausgesetzt, den Benutzer wieder mittels:

exit

Hintergrund: https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-38198

CVE-2024-7646
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-16T18:31:08

2 posts

A security issue was discovered in ingress-nginx where an actor with permission to create Ingress objects (in the `networking.k8s.io` or `extensions` API group) can bypass annotation validation to inject arbitrary commands and obtain the credentials of the ingress-nginx controller. In the default configuration, that credential has access to all secrets in the cluster.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:58:18.754Z ##

Fortinet big mad about watchTowr: FG-IR-24-463
CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection

This vulnerability was publiclly disclosed by Watchtowr, without following industry standard responsible disclosure process, and advertised via their X account.

Note that to the best of our knowledge, this vulnerability has not been observed to be exploited in the wild.

cc: @GossiTheDog This appears to be #fortijumphigher: watchTowr: Hop-Skip-FortiJump-FortiJump-Higher - Fortinet FortiManager CVE-2024-47575 from 15 November 2024.

updated 2024-02-04T05:06:50

2 posts

Summary of Vulnerability A template injection vulnerability on older versions of Confluence Data Center and Server allows an unauthenticated attacker to achieve RCE on an affected instance. Customers using an affected version must take immediate action. Most recent supported versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are not affected by this vulnerability as it was ultimately mitigated during

@zl2tod @jerry Yeah January 2024 was a fun month:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti zero-day CVE-2023-46805 (UNPATCHED): https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024
    • Citrix zero-days CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
    • Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-0519: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
    • Atlassian perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 CVE-2024-22527 https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-server-1333990257.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as a zero-day as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti discloses new zero-day CVE-2024-21887 and releases first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

(9.1 CRITICAL)

updated 2024-01-22T18:31:16

5 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

##

CVE-2024-0282
(3.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-01-07T18:30:35

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in Kashipara Food Management System up to 1.0. It has been classified as problematic. This affects an unknown part of the file addmaterialsubmit.php. The manipulation of the argument tin leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The identifier VDB-249837 was assigned to this

1 repos

https://github.com/rxwx/pulse-meter

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T01:07:27.105Z ##

Mandiant: Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above. Mandiant has identified zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 in the wild beginning mid-December 2024. CVE-2025-0282 is an unauthenticated stack-based buffer overflow. Successful exploitation could result in unauthenticated remote code execution, leading to potential downstream compromise of a victim network.

Mandiant describes the exploitation details, and observed post-exploitation activity by the threat actor. This includes anti-forensics measures, persistence, malware deployment, and credential harvesting. Mandiant does not make a strong attribution but notes that UNC5337, a China-nexus cluster, is the only threat actor known to deploy the SPAWN ecosystem of malware on Ivanti Connect Secure appliances. Mandiant suspects with medium confidence that UNC5337 is part of UNC5221. Yara rules are free but indicators of compromise are behind a registration wall on VirusTotal.

#china #cyberespionage #ivanti #zeroday #CVE_2024_0282 #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Yara #infosec #cybersecurity #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-09T01:07:27.000Z ##

Mandiant: Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Targeted in New Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above. Mandiant has identified zero-day exploitation of CVE-2025-0282 in the wild beginning mid-December 2024. CVE-2025-0282 is an unauthenticated stack-based buffer overflow. Successful exploitation could result in unauthenticated remote code execution, leading to potential downstream compromise of a victim network.

Mandiant describes the exploitation details, and observed post-exploitation activity by the threat actor. This includes anti-forensics measures, persistence, malware deployment, and credential harvesting. Mandiant does not make a strong attribution but notes that UNC5337, a China-nexus cluster, is the only threat actor known to deploy the SPAWN ecosystem of malware on Ivanti Connect Secure appliances. Mandiant suspects with medium confidence that UNC5337 is part of UNC5221. Yara rules are free but indicators of compromise are behind a registration wall on VirusTotal.

#china #cyberespionage #ivanti #zeroday #CVE_2024_0282 #vulnerability #eitw #ActiveExploitation #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Yara #infosec #cybersecurity #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

##

CVE-2002-0649(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 96.30%

updated 2023-01-30T05:06:06

1 posts

Multiple buffer overflows in the Resolution Service for Microsoft SQL Server 2000 and Microsoft Desktop Engine 2000 (MSDE) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code via UDP packets to port 1434 in which (1) a 0x04 byte that causes the SQL Monitor thread to generate a long registry key name, or (2) a 0x08 byte with a long string causes heap corruption, as exploit

kubikpixel@chaos.social at 2025-01-08T14:10:12.000Z ##

SQLslammer worm FBI FOIA docs

FOIA documents from the #FBI in response to a request for records relating to the #SQLslammer worm that first appeared in 2003 but has continued to infect #computer's in some form until the 2020s.

The worm exploited a buffer overflow #bug in #Microsoft's #SQL #Server and #Desktop Engine #database products. Although the MS02-039 (CVE-2002-0649) patch had been released six months earlier, many organizations had not yet applied it.

🥁 https://archive.org/details/sqlslammer/

##

CVE-2024-12084
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

13 posts

N/A

jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-01-14T19:45:48.000Z ##

Anybody know whether the issue in CVE-2024-12084 is strictly within "rsyncd", or does this also affect "rsync --server --sender"?

If so, then that would impact a lot more deployments, i.e., those that depend on SSH as the transport.

##
elfy@chaos.social at 2025-01-14T18:47:52.000Z ##

Service toot for sysadmin folks:

There's six vulnerabilities in #rsync, including a CVSS of 9.8: "In the most severe CVE, an attacker only requires
anonymous read access to a rsync server, such as a public mirror, to
execute arbitrary code on the machine the server is running on."

Full report of all six vulnerabilities: https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/01/14/3

The most critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-12084) seems to be fixed in Debian Stable atm: https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/source-package/rsync

#cybercybercyber #PatchThePlanet

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-01-14T18:26:09.000Z ##

6 new CVEs in "rsync".

"In the most severe CVE, an attacker only requires anonymous read access to a rsync server, such as a public mirror, to execute arbitrary code on the machine the server is running on."

That would be CVE-2024-12084 (9.8) AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H, a heap-based buffer overflow in rsyncd.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/01/14/3

##
samueloph@mastodon.social at 2025-01-14T18:26:03.000Z ##

-- CRITICAL CVE UPDATE FOR DEBIAN--

Fixes for a critical rsync vulnerability (CVE-2024-12084) have been released for Stable/Bookworm, Testing and Unstable. Oldstable/Bullseye is not affected. Fixes for other lower severity CVEs have also been released in the same update and can all be tracked at https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/source-package/rsync. The fixed Stable version is 3.2.7-1+deb12u1 and the fixed Testing/Unstable version is 3.3.0+ds1-3

Debian should publish a micronews article about this soon.

##
screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.318Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-01-14T19:45:48.000Z ##

Anybody know whether the issue in CVE-2024-12084 is strictly within "rsyncd", or does this also affect "rsync --server --sender"?

If so, then that would impact a lot more deployments, i.e., those that depend on SSH as the transport.

##
xeiaso.net@bsky.brid.gy at 2025-01-14T19:11:58.258Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-12084/

"No way to prevent this" say u...

##
cadey@pony.social at 2025-01-14T19:11:58.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-12084/?utm_campaign=mi_irl&utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-01-14T18:26:09.000Z ##

6 new CVEs in "rsync".

"In the most severe CVE, an attacker only requires anonymous read access to a rsync server, such as a public mirror, to execute arbitrary code on the machine the server is running on."

That would be CVE-2024-12084 (9.8) AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H, a heap-based buffer overflow in rsyncd.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/01/14/3

##
samueloph@mastodon.social at 2025-01-14T18:26:03.000Z ##

-- CRITICAL CVE UPDATE FOR DEBIAN--

Fixes for a critical rsync vulnerability (CVE-2024-12084) have been released for Stable/Bookworm, Testing and Unstable. Oldstable/Bullseye is not affected. Fixes for other lower severity CVEs have also been released in the same update and can all be tracked at https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/source-package/rsync. The fixed Stable version is 3.2.7-1+deb12u1 and the fixed Testing/Unstable version is 3.3.0+ds1-3

Debian should publish a micronews article about this soon.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T17:17:48.000Z ##

For the "btw i use arch" crowd: CERT/CC: Rsync contains six vulnerabilities
Rsync, a versatile file-synchronizing tool, contains six vulnerabilities present within versions 3.3.0 and below. Rsync can be used to sync files between remote and local computers, as well as storage devices. The discovered vulnerabilities include heap-buffer overflow, information leak, file leak, external directory file-write,–safe-links bypass, and symbolic-link race condition.

  • CVE-2024-12084 A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability > OOB write
  • CVE-2024-12085 information leak
  • CVE-2024-12086 file leak
  • CVE-2024-12087 path traversal > file write
  • CVE-2024-12088 safe-links option vulnerability> file write
  • CVE-2024-12747 symbolic-link race condition > privesc

Affects: Arch Linux, Gentoo, NixOS, and Triton Data Center

#vulnerability #rsync #vulnerability #linux #infosec #cve #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-50563
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.914Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy
  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

#fortinet #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity #cve

  13. FG-IR-23-405 CVE-2024-26012 (6.7 medium) FortiAP - Restricted Shell Escape via CLI Command Injection
  14. FG-IR-23-458 CVE-2024-21758 (6.4 medium) FortiWeb - Stack overflow in execute backup command
  15. FG-IR-24-211 CVE-2024-52967 (3.5 low) HTML Content Injection
  16. FG-IR-24-216 CVE-2024-50564 (3.3 low) Hardcoded Encryption Key Used for Named Pipe Communication
  17. FG-IR-23-260 CVE-2023-37936 (9.8 critical) Hardcoded Session Secret Leading to Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
  18. FG-IR-23-407 CVE-2023-46715 (5.0 medium) IPsec dynamic assignation IP spoofing
  19. FG-IR-24-210 CVE-2024-47572 (9.0 critical) Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-14T15:13:32.000Z ##

The rest of the #PatchTuesday security advisories from Fortinet:

  1. FG-IR-24-239 CVE-2024-47571 (8.1 high) Admin Account Persistence after Deletion
  2. FG-IR-24-143 CVE-2024-33502 (6.5 medium) Arbitrary file delete on firmware import image feature
  3. FG-IR-24-097 CVE-2024-32115 (5.5 medium) Arbitrary file deletion in administrative interface
  4. FG-IR-24-152 CVE-2024-36512 (7.2 high) Arbitrary file write on GUI
  5. FG-IR-24-417 CVE-2024-52969 (4.1 medium) Blind SQL injection in Update
  6. FG-IR-23-220 CVE-2023-37931 (8.8 high) Blind SQL injection vulnerability
  7. FG-IR-23-381 CVE-2023-4863 ("7.5 high" / NVD 8.8 high) CVE-2023-4863 - Heap overflow in Chrome/libwebp
    • bruv I recognize a historical exploited zero-day when I see one: CVE-2023-4863, this is that libwebp thing that we were arguing about with Google 2 years ago!
  8. FG-IR-24-222 CVE-2024-46662 (8.8 high) Command injection in csfd daemon
  9. FG-IR-24-164 CVE-2024-46667 (7.5 high) Denial of Service in TLS-SYSLOG handler
  10. FG-IR-23-476 CVE-2024-23106 (8.1 high) EMS console login under brute force attack does not get locked
  11. FG-IR-24-326 CVE-2024-46665 (3.7 low) Exposure of sensitive information in RADIUS Accounting-Request
  12. FG-IR-24-282 CVE-2024-54021 (6.5 medium) File-Filter Bypass in Explicit Web Proxy Policy

  20. FG-IR-24-267 CVE-2024-46669 (3.5 low) Integer Overflow in ipsec ike
  21. FG-IR-24-135 CVE-2024-35277 (8.6 high) Missing authentication for managed device configuration files
  22. FG-IR-24-219 CVE-2024-46668 (7.5) Multipart Form Data Denial of Service
  23. FG-IR-24-127 CVE-2024-33503 (6.7 medium) CVE-2024-45331 (6.7 possibly?) Multiple privilege escalation
  24. FG-IR-23-293 CVE-2023-42785 and CVE-2023-42786 (both 6.5 medium) Null pointer dereference leading to sslvpn DOS
  25. FG-IR-24-463 CVE-2024-50566 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  26. FG-IR-24-061 CVE-2024-27778 (8.8 high) OS command injection
  27. FG-IR-24-266 CVE-2024-46670 (7.5 high) Out of bounds read in ipsec ike
  28. FG-IR-24-373 CVE-2024-52963 (3.7 low) Out-of-bounds Write in IPSEC Daemon
  29. FG-IR-24-106 CVE-2024-35273 (7.2 high) Out-of-bounds Write in sndproxy
  30. FG-IR-24-259 CVE-2024-48884 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-48885 (7.5 possibly?) Path traversal in csfd daemon
  31. FG-IR-23-258 CVE-2023-37937 (7.8 high) Restricted Shell Escape via Argument Injection
  32. FG-IR-24-091 CVE-2024-35275 (6.6 medium) SQL injections in sdnproxy daemon
  33. FG-IR-23-473 CVE-2024-36504 (6.5 medium) SSLVPN DOS
  34. FG-IR-24-165 CVE-2024-35276 (5.6 medium) Stack based buffer overflow in httpd
  35. FG-IR-24-250 CVE-2024-46666 (5.3 medium) Unchecked boundary length causing multiple logic flaws
  36. FG-IR-24-221 CVE-2024-48886 (9.0 critical) and CVE-2024-50563 (9.0 possibly?) Weak Authentication in csfd daemon
  37. FG-IR-23-494 CVE-2022-23439 (4.7 medium) Host header injection

Notes: Other than the zero-day CVE-2024-55591 and backporting patches for the older zero-day CVE-2023-4863, there is no other mention of exploitation.

EDIT: I discovered additional security advisories. Not all of them showed up in the RSS feed.

screaminggoat at 2025-01-14T02:57:14.243Z ##

Apple security advisory 13 January 2025: About the security content of Apple Music 1.5.0.152 for Windows
CVE-2024-54540 (score pending) Processing maliciously crafted web content may disclose internal states of the app. The issue was addressed with improved input sanitization.

No mention of exploitation. cc: @applsec

CVE-2024-22527
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2025-01-09T02:09:44.957Z ##

@zl2tod @jerry Yeah January 2024 was a fun month:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti zero-day CVE-2023-46805 (UNPATCHED): https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024
    • Citrix zero-days CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
    • Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-0519: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
    • Atlassian perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 CVE-2024-22527 https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-server-1333990257.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as a zero-day as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti discloses new zero-day CVE-2024-21887 and releases first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVE-2024-52875
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

3 posts

N/A

Nuclei template

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-01-08T19:10:09.000Z ##

Hackers exploit KerioControl firewall flaw to steal admin CSRF tokens

Hackers are trying to exploit CVE-2024-52875, a critical CRLF injection vulnerability that leads to 1-click remote code execution (RCE) attacks in...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/eba9tm

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-08T00:55:09.000Z ##

@ntkramer @greynoise here's all the references:

  • Censys article: January 7 Advisory: GFI KerioControl Susceptible to 1-Click RCE Vulnerability [CVE-2024-52875]
  • Vulnerability reporter: https://karmainsecurity.com/KIS-2024-07
    • Vulnerability analysis: https://karmainsecurity.com/hacking-kerio-control-via-cve-2024-52875
    • Reporter's Proof of Concept: https://karmainsecurity.com/pocs/CVE-2024-52875.php
  • NVD: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52875 (CVE ID Not Found)
  • cve.org: https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-52875 (This ID has been reserved by a CNA.)
##
ntkramer@infosec.exchange at 2025-01-07T23:02:38.000Z ##

Our friends at Censys released an advisory regarding Kerio CVE-2024-52875. We at @greynoise began observing exploit attempts on December 28. Although the IP addresses involved are currently quite noisy, it's notable that they predominantly trace from Singapore to Lithuania. #threatintel

https://viz.greynoise.io/tags/kerio-control-cve-2024-52875-crlf-injection-attempt?days=30

##
